text: Food was somewhat good lots to choose from but a friend of mine had a problem with her food and asked to have something done about it... the manager on duty wasn't will to give any comps or refunds...liked this as a first time but the service for my friend has pretty much destroyed any chance of us coming back or recommending to others...

Quick tip -- I would save your dollars, and use it towards a better fresher, cooked to order meal at one of the casino's other restaurants.  Being spoiled by the food and numerous buffets in the greater San Francisco area, I found this casino buffet to be not all that great for the price I paid at dinner time.  For $26+ I kind of expected some crustaceans and perhaps sushi, but after thinking about the location, I do realize Arizona is not surrounded by any huge bodies of water, but then again, neither is Vegas and I do recall eating some decent seafood at Vegas buffets for a lot less.  For Asian international fair, they had panda express food.  For their pasta selection, it was pesto pasta (meatless, and probably could have found that at Soup Plantation) and cheese ravioli.  For the carving station, it was brisket and something else that didn't look too good to try.  Their skillet potatoes were mushy, there was no prime rib, the steaks shouldn't have even been a buffet choice since they don't do too well sitting around, and their salmon is awefully dry.  I found myself endulging on the desserts (lots of pudding pie in all different flavors), steamed veggies, and the mexican food that is not worth $26+.  I actually thoroughly enjoyed my Famous Daves meal like 5 times more than this joint, during my stay here in Arizona.
Went for lunch today. We looked before we bought and it did look better than it tasted. I don't think we'll return, but will try other dining options in the casino.

Wonderful buffet! Chinese, Mexican & western fair! Soups, salads and appetizers galore. Pepper crusted roast beef that is out of this world... Let's not forget the desert bar...... Yummmmm! We had a great meal and a lot of fun!!!

Went for the lunch buffet. The selection was mostly mexican and chinese along with pizza and sundry meats. the dishes were okay. For a price of $30 for two people, I have had better meals. Yes, there were a lot of choices but the quality was not great. nothing stood out for me. did not even feel like trying the desserts as nothing seemed appealing.

Great customer service, loved seeing the chef at the Desert station, helping customers. Everyone was so helpful. Had a waiter by the name of Ralph that was amazing! Food was Amazing!!! Highly recommend this place.

I'm not going to be long winded on this one. My wife and I went for a Saturday Night Dinner Buffet and it didn't disappoint. Nutshell? It was exactly like the Sunday Brunch without the Eggs and Pancakes. Delicious Seafood and meat selections. King Crab Legs were great, Lobster claws hit the spot! Beware of the Crab Legs Frenzy! Apparently the idea of All You Can Eat Crab Legs turns people into crazed Zombies as they will become insane when the platters come out!  Get here early. At 430-5 there was a short line, by 6 it was insane! I can only imagine people waited probably an hour or more to get in there.

Exceptionally good. Our server was very attentive and friendly. We saw listed "Calzones to order", which  I stay clear of pizza on a buffet but my husband ordered one.  All I can say is  delicious (keep in mind you must wait for it to cook). The tortellini is to die for too. You have so many choices on this buffet. Excellent!

I'm from Reno so in comparison to the buffets there, this one is lacking. The selection of foods is very small and poorly maintained. They were out of several dishes the first time I went through the line and didn't stock appropriate dishes next to some of the stations, i.e. soup bowls, small cups for dipping sauces, dinner plates, etc. Food quality was just ok. I probably wouldn't come again.

There was a little piece  of white plastic in my salted caramel ice cream which is probably fell from the ice cream scoop,I thought it was a sea salt so I bite it and tiny pieces of plastics shattered  in my mouth,took them out (hopefully I didn't swallow any but I'm not sure) showed the dessert server lady who almost didn't say anything except ok when I suggested her to check her ice cream,all I wanted was apology,I know mistakes happen,especially during this holiday time the restaurants can be pretty busy and hard to keep everything perfect but come on,just one word would've make me leave happy

Waiting..........waiting........waiting.........waiting The Choice of food is excellent but there are some real drawbacks  1) Waiting- There are so many ways to let patrons know that they have 20-30 minute wait  2) Staff and Service  2 out of 5 - Not attentive / Missed Order  3) DARK - There are caves with more light - Why does a buffet need to be so dark

The buffet selections are on par with the Wynn's in Las Vegas or any other casino resort. But what sets this spot apart is their customer service and attention to details. I felt really cater and attend to throughout my dinning experience. The staffs at the buffet seems like they got it down. Five stars for that. Definitely be back when I'm in town again.

Everything was delicious!!! The primerib was to die for!! I needed a bigger stomach. The waiter was johnny on the spot for everything! Everything tasted so fresh. It was better than most buffet's I've been to in vegas and just about one of the best one's I've ever been to. Don't pass up!

This review is for the breakfast buffet.  Pro:  value, variety, views  Con: smokers and gamblers you encounter en route.  low class.  Wuddya expect, it's a friggin' casino.   Even so, it certainly does the trick for a cheap "I could eat a horse but I'm broke" breakfast call.  You name it,  they probably offer it:  Mexican, American, Chinese,  even gelato, and a very decent fresh fruit offering.  Servers have always been friendly on my visits.   Surprisingly good for kids and the $1 keno games are a nice side bar.  It's what I'd imagine a low budget cruise ship buffet to be.  I'm at 2.5 stars on this place; a definite "meh".

Very unimpressed with this buffet. When the queue wrapped around the casino (along with the $55 price tag for the Mother's Day special), we were anticipating great food. After doing a quick walk around the buffet to check out the options, we could already tell that we were not pleased with the limited variety of options. There were numerous meat dishes but not much else.  As a meat lover, I was excited to indulge, and I'm not picky at all when it comes to meat dishes. But of the prime rib, beef steak, lamb chops, and crab legs, only the lamb chops were edible. I never leave meat unfinished, but I couldn't bring myself to finish the rubbery rib and completely bland steak. The crab legs felt like they had been laying in the freezer for weeks. Fresh king crab legs were the major selling point for even coming to this buffet, and this was a major disappointment. As for the desserts, the raspberry mousse was bitter and lacked any sweetness. The cheesecake was lacking, and I could have bought better at Albertson's. The nutella pancake was actually decent. As were the breakfast potatoes and hash brown. The one major upside to the brunch was the delicious bloody mary's included. Overall we were very disappointed with our overall experience at this buffet. There are $13 buffets that are far more satisfying than this one. Would never recommend this place to a friend. Maybe the high volume of customers for Mother's Day led to the subpar quality of food, but this did not meet any of our expectations whatsoever. With the tip we spent over $150 dollars for two people, which would have been better spent at numerous other upscale restaurants.

Have been to the buffet twice for dinner and every time i leave totally satisfied with everything that is offered. I actually wish i could fit more in my stomach. The chefs do a wonderful job and have a exceptional variety from around the globe. Service is also top notch and pleasant. Cant wait to go back.

I"ve eaten here many times and it is always very tasty food.  It is hard to find something that doesn't fit the palate here. You don't get the glitz and shine that is everywhere in the Las Vegas hotels, but for pure taste and culinary satisfaction, you can't beat the Wandering Horse Buffet.  It ranks up there with best of what Las Vegas offers without the travel.  Highly recommended!

We ate here on a Friday night. Food was ok, everything was just ok. The lobster claws and crab legs were good. They are cold, so if you are a fan of hot lobster you can have them reheat them, the crab legs are split in half (bonus) but you can't really reheat those. The Kobe beef was good, but small pieces. I think the brunch is must better than the dinner. The deserts seemed to be of the high end premade frozen type. The staff behind the buffet appeared to be upset when they had to replenish  the food. Oh we'll, we won't be back for dinner, but probably for breakfast.

Lunch  While staying at the resort, I was not especially hungry, but really did not want to eat a bunch of junk. I went to the Wandering Horse buffet.  Price $12.95 plus tax.  I had smoked salmon, antipasta, salad, fruit, and then prime rib, roast pork, a few calamari and shrimp, more salad, and called it a day.  I could have had smoked salmon and prime rib all day but that would be really living it up, and I would have felt that I over ate at lunch. The thought did cross my mind.  At In-And-Out burgers, #1 is $ 5.50, so this was definitely 3 times better than a # 1.  If you are around here, really go to the buffet.

This review is for the breakfast buffet, which I believe opens at 8AM. I arrived at 8:30 AM and was promptly seated (this was a Saturday morning) the very large banquet room was very empty, but I was starving, so I didn't care. The waitperson was very attentive, I must say her service was excellent. My concerns... #1 my biggest concern was at 8:30 AM (remember they open at *) the carving station, although all lit up had only a bone with no meat and a carving knife on display. During the course of my leisurely brunch (8:30 AM to 11:30 AM) the scene never changed. RIPOFF!!!! There was supposed to be ham or beef available at the carving station. The rest of the buffet is pretty standard fare, BUT... the bacon was somehow greasy and underdone while at the same time stuck together in a greasy clump. The link sausages were greasy and semi raw! I'm sorry, but the "cook" in charge of this dismal small buffet should be canned. I'm not upset that it is a limited buffet ( they don't even have scrambled eggs), I'm upset that with minimal offerings, the "cook" should make the buffet shine. 5 stars to the egg station! They are the only reason that there are two stars instead of one.

The Wandering Horse is a really well done buffet that I have found to be consistently clean with an very good selection of fresh items and friendly if occasionally spotty table service. The buffet offers a standard blend of the tried and true steak, prime rib, salad bar combo with a nice blend of Mexican, Italian, Asian selections as well.  I've eaten here at least 15 times since they opened, entertaining in-laws, business associates, and friends for lunch, dinner, and brunch having never left hungry or disappointed in anything save for the soups. Service has gotten consistently better and the food has stayed very consistently good. I would love to give five stars but on numerous occasions the soups have been under-seasoned and terribly bland.

Wow what a horrible experience. Went Sunday night and asked for a table for 6. 3 couples all paid separately but 18% tip tacked on all bills. Waiter was horrendous. We finally had to go to server area and get our own pitcher of tea and then again for water. Waiter never noticed. He was clueless. I guess since he had his tip of 21.00 for table he didn't care. Buffet was so so. Not a lot of taste. With the prices we paid should have been better. Salad bar was a joke. Deserts were really good! Would not eat here again.
I've came here for Saturday lunches a few times and I believe it's worth the $. The food that's put out is always fresh.
For Scottsdale, this buffet is just as good as a Vegas buffet!! and their pool parties have just as many pretty people in them! Talking Stick Casino overall is very good and clean!!
Christmas buffet here is yummy ~ come with an appetite and good friends and family. I've also been to the spa- the facials are amazing

The Wandering Horse Buffet at Talking Stick is quite nice. It's well set up with many large booths and tables. One entire side of the restaurant is all windows offering a bright atmosphere (in an otherwise dark casino) and a nice view of the mountains. For $26.95, you can't go wrong. I tried a fraction of what they offer but what I did have was quite good.  There is a large and quite varied selection of food. Included was an Asian section, Mexican section, Italian section, fresh crab legs, oysters, shrimp and many different options of meat at the carving station. If you are a non red meat eater, there was salmon and chicken. There's quite a nice selection of potatoes; mashed, hash browns and country style. Also included was a salad bar, a selection of soups, fresh vegetables, waffles, pancakes and made to order omelets. The desserts included cakes, mousses, tarts, pies, gelato, crepes as well as other pastry items. My favorite was the jalapeño bacon, probably the best bacon I've ever had. I'm sure I'm forgetting something but no matter your palate, you will definitely find something.  As with most casinos, the clientele can be interesting and Talking Stick is no exception. There was a varied group of people which always makes for good people watching. Is the buffet on par with The Phoenician, no. Is it better than most buffets, definitely yes. Would I go back? Yes!

Overall,  good buffet selection.  Went there on Valentine's day craving for some seafood buffet.  They served complimentary champagne and unlimited lobster claws that night. The line was long but it was  worth the wait.  Asian dishes could be improved, I think.

This review is for the lunch buffet.  Been here a bunch of times for lunch, and although its gone up slightly, its still worth the $14.  There is a great variety including plenty of seafood dishes.  The steaks, the shrimp fajitas, the chinese selections, the artisan cheeses, the pizza & pasta, the fish & chips, the salads, the smoked salmon, the soups, and even the sugar free cheesecake are all very good.  A little different than the typical buffet, the food is served in smaller portions on the buffet.  So most choices seem pretty fresh.  Its a nice, spacious room with great views.  And far enough seperated from the casino so that you don't smell the smoke or hear any of the noise.  Not that there's anything wrong with that :)  We've had great service on each visit as well.  I can't speak to the dinner or brunch buffets, but based on the lunch selection and quality, I'm sure the rest is very good.  Will have to try the dinner soon.  Work up a hunger... settle in... and enjoy!

Went to the buffet for both breakfast and dinner. Breakfast was Good for 12 dollars, a lot of options with refresh fruits and gelato. Their Friday dinner buffet was really awesome. For 33 dollars you are getting king crab legs, stone crabs, oyster and so much more. It was great for a seafood lover like me. They have a lot of dessert selection as well including sugar free and gluten free choices. Definitely worth a visit. Come early at dinner. People start to line up before the dinner starts.
little to no seasoning/flavor on any of the dishes at lunch today. Of the hot dishes, the majority appeared dried out. Nothing really stood out as great...
Well done Cindy and Ana. I forgot to take a picture of pizza,they made it very special and cheesy.I love it so much and its delicious too. By the way, everything in there taste good...

This past Saturday night I convinced my husband to go out & have dinner at a buffet. I have been wanting to go to Wandering Horse for a while now, so we made the trek out to Scottsdale. The last time we were here it was in the tents, so it was all new to us. The remodel is beautiful! Wish we could have checked out the rooms.  We also met his cousin & our friend there. We were seated right away & went right to the buffet. As soon as we got back to the table our sweet server took our drink orders. She checked on us a few times & made sure empty glasses were refilled.  There was so much freakin food! This has definitely got to be the best buffet in AZ. Some of my fav items were: fried shrimp, salmon, kobe beef, broccolini, shrimp scampi, bread with pesto spread & cheese, roasted corn on the cob, mashed potatoes, mussels, fried rice, pizza, pork eggrolls-I'm sure there's more but you get the idea. Dessert was pretty good as well. Some fav items there were: mint chocolate chip gelato, fruit tarts, creme brulee, some strawberry/white cake creation & the boys fav-a crepe with warm nutella!  At 1st, I was going to dock a star for the $27 per person price tag, but it was just so good I had to give it 5 stars. I'd love to come back on a Sunday for brunch & take full advantage of the endless mimosas!

Good service, decent price, nice selection but the Oysters had gone very...VERY BAD. Once I took a bite I immediately spit it out and wiped my tongue with napkins. I had to suck on couple of lemons to get the bad taste and smell out of my mouth. Selection doesn't count when the items are inedible. Never again. Disappointed.
The deserts were old tasting and not very big of a selection for food. The drinks are expensive and barely, if any, liquor in them.
Really bad buffet even for a casino buffet. Tried many of the choices and all were bland. Cheesecake was actually stale. Try one of the other restaurants. This was major disappointment.

We tried the lunch buffet on a Thursday.  I had heard good things about it and it was even better than I expected.  Very good selection including beef and fish dishes, pizza and pasta.  Desserts were varied and quite good.  The wait staff was attentive and we had a very nice view of the mountains.  The price, which included a beverage,  was not much more than Old Country Buffet but infinitely better.  We will return.

First time in the area, first time in this Buffett. The steak is beyond delish. Mashed potatoes and gravy hit the spot. Iced tea was refreshing. Atmosphere is nice, casual. Employees are very helpful. Give koodos to Angelo for helping us find directions to the fast track. He even took the time to write down the directions for us. His suggestion and going out of his way for customer satisfaction. Angelo represented the company well. Thank you.

***********If you don't appreciate......"The Best of The Best"........ stay away**************   Wandering Horse has always provided a TEN STAR dinning expierence. The food is Fanstatic. The service is beyond OUTSTANDING.  I've been going there, since they opened.  Wandering Horse you're ...... "a Class Act".
They always have a wide variety to choose from. Pizza to pasta, salad to cheese and crackers, Chinese fried rice to quesadillas, steak to mashes potatoes. Not to mention a wide selection of desserts.
Excellent Mother's Day brunch! Great selection, and very attentive staff. We sat for hours visiting and never felt rushed to leave so they could have our table. Well worth the price!!

We were super excited about trying this buffet.  We were in town visiting and after a long day doing the Apache Trails we wanted to really stuff our faces.  We got there just before 6, there was a line of maybe 8 parties ahead of us but the line moved quickly.  For 2 adults dinner on a Saturday it came to a total of $73.30 including tax.  Not much cheaper than going to the Caesar's Buffet in Vegas.  We were promptly seated.  Our servers were really good, very friendly, prompt, always refilling our glasses.  Now in terms of the food, we were a little let down.  We tried everything from the stations and everything was pretty average.  Everyone goes crazy over the crab legs but even they tasted really bland.  We were so excited for the desserts, they have a huge selection but again they looked better than they tasted.  I think we'll stick to Caesar's from now on.

I went here with the expectation that it would like your run of the mill Vegas buffet, but I was wrong. It was sooo much worse. This place is definitely those looking for quantity over quality.   We went for "seafood night." This consists of badly tasting lobster claws, gross oysters, mediocre crab legs, etc. I was extremely disappointed in the seafood selection especially knowing that all of the other restaurants in this casino have amazing seafood.   All of the other food choices were mediocre at best.  The deserts were not very good either. Even though there was a big selection I couldn't find a single one I liked. Meanwhile, I was with a diabetic who only picked the "sugar free" options. ***WARNING*** they are NOT sugar free. His blood sugar spiked as soon as he left. A very scary thing to mislabel.   Overall, not an enjoyable experience and will not be back.
I really like coming here for lunch on Sat or throughout the week! It's decently priced for lunch and the food is pretty consistently good! I also love their hot green jasmine tea--delicious!!
You dont get a better buffet than this.  Been to vegas and atlantic city buffets, and this rivals them.  Great service, excellent food.  Best in arizona.

We stayed for 5 nights at the Talking Stick Resort on vacation. This buffet restaurant has an extensive display of international foods. We ate here three times for breakfast and it was quite delicious. For breakfast there is an omelet station, extensive granola/musueli choices, yogurt, pastries, various meats including peppered bacon that was sliced to order. Eggs were cooked well and the biscuits with gravy was one of my favorites. One day the gravy had a chopped corned beef and another day it was regular sausage-type gravy...both were delicious. We also had a donut each morning.Yeah, I know it wasn't on my diet...but hey, I was on vacation. The variety of fresh fruit was impressive...juicy, plump blackberries, strawberries, blueberries, fresh pineapple. Ummmm....My mouth is watering just thinking about it.   We ate once in the Wandering Horse for lunch. It was good, but not quite as tasty as the breakfast, but definitely can find something you like. The fried shrimp were plump, good seasoning and great breading. There was Mexican, Asian, American and pizza stations. The salad bar was really good and they had about 14 different flavors of ice creams, gelatos and sorbet. The sorbets and gelatos were actually more delicious than the ice cream. Definitely worth a trip for the reasonable breakfast price of $9.95 and lunch of $12.95.

A lot of choices, but nothing stood out as a must have.  The desserts were very good, but everything else was just ordinary.  Bring your wallet if you plan on drinking alcohol.  I guess the Tribe has to pay for that beautiful new building somehow.  Drinks way overpriced.

If you're staying at the Talking Stick Resort, this is a very convenient way to have a relaxed meal and you should be able to find some foods you really like. I noticed a selection of olives, fresh mozarella and tomato and picked up a serving. There was a carving station serving fresh pork, and I also got some shrimp.  For dessert, there was a wide selection of gelatos with an assortment of toppings like shredded coconut, Oreo cookies and m&ms.  Naturally there were numerous other choices, these were my picks. The staff were friendly and attentive.  Overall it was a great value, the pricing was really fair. There is also a large bar if you want cocktails.  One thing to think about is tipping - I tipped when I checked in at the front desk, but probably should have waited to tip the server directly. I ended up tipping a second time because the waitress gave good service and I did not want to leave her empty handed.

It' was first time at Wandering Horse Buffet. The Dinner buffet Hours 4:30 - 10:00PM , I was directed to dinner table about 8-30 PM , waiting on line for kingcrab legs 7 minutes (kingcrab legs had been frozen for long time (better got from Fry's or Costco); 3 minutes waiting for NY steak -(sorry we do not have anymore NY steak at 8:50 PM ), swing back on line for little neck clams 10 minutes waiting -(sorry , no more clams), complainted to Restaurant's Manager - (sorry , we do our best ).And then I went to Casino's Restroom before leaving this Resort , the  restroom was dirty liked Waltmart ' restroom .I have rather paying $15.00 at regular buffet restaurant , alot better then paying $36.65 at WDH Buffet when the foods was underrated .

Not to be repetitious, but really nice buffet. No one's addressed the regular (non-Sunday) breakfast, but for $9.95 you get juice, coffee and food. Omelets, cheeses, bacon and thick cut applewood smoked if you want, smoked salmon (not little pieces, but a whole slab o' fish you slice off a piece yourself) and all those deserts (pastries, pies, cakes, etc.) including the sorbets. And then there are the non-US selections with Thai, Japanese and other cuisines represented. Fantastic ranges of spices and flavors. And kudoes to the designers for keeping the 'sausage-making' out of view of the diners, making the entire experience more pleasant than most buffets.

I had taken a peek at the Thursday night dinner buffet offerings and decided to go back for lunch on Saturday with my husband.  After checking out the bufffet, he decided to go to the Ocean Trail restaurant at the casino for the red beans and rice (always delicious there) and I dined alone at the buffet. I was disappointed and unimpressed with what I ate there.  The roast (prime rib?) was extremely hard to cut with the knife I had, and VERY rare. (And I like it rare, usually.)  The pork chops were too hard and dry to cut, the turkey looked very overdone so I didn't even try it, the fish was overcooked, the eggplant had a sauce that tasted like unseasoned tomato sauce from a can.  I tried one of the small bits of grilled steak ( not grilled to order)  and it was so-so, but I didn't expect fantastic steak on a buffet.  I also tried a marinated cucumber salad that was too sweet to enjoy.  The scallop lo mein was awful-- Panda express would do a better job with that!  I tried the chili-- it was not great. The shrimp enchiladas were not bad-- probably one of the better dishes I tried.  There were no refried beans, only charro beans at the Mexican food station.  I sampled some good cheese ( hard to mess up cheese) and it was good.  The asparagus was good, the mashed potatoes and gravy were good, and the sorbets were good, too.  The mango and prickly pear flavors were great. To tell you the truth, I prefer the buffet at Fort McDowell casino-- seems to be better quality and a lower price.  I think there is a lot of room for improvement at Talking Stick.
definitely above average American buffet. reasonable price. generally fresh food and lots of dessert options~!

Like any buffet, food selection is plentiful for price. Eat what you like... Ate lunch which was average to good (some things better than others).  They offered wood fired pizzas, many salads, mexican, Stir fry, grilled pork, chicken, grilled vegetables...numerous desserts..  Menu changes depending upon chef.  Clean, attentive staff.  Located right in casino.

Went there for lunch today. Not many items but what they DID have was delicious. I was hoping for a larger selection, at least a fraction of a Vegas buffet since it IS a casino. Anyway, they had great fresh pizza with handmade mozz, tri-tip, pork belly, hunan shrimp, apricot stilton cheese, asparagus, Thai spring rolls, wontons, lots of desserts. Too many desserts. Way to keep America obese. Again I expected more of a selection for a casino buffet but everything was quality and service was nice. $15.20 total before tip for weekday lunch. No wow factor here but the pizza was scrumptious and cheesy.

I had the Sunday brunch buffet last Sunday. At first, I considered it to be the best buffet I've had outside of Vegas until I came down with food poisoning. It was the buffet because my wife is fine and we've shared every meal together the past several days and she is fine. She didn't eat any of the meats or seafood. I'm thinking it was the raw oysters that tasted a bit off. I'm into day three now and I'm absolutely livid. For the price I payed for the buffet, the food should've been fresh so I wouldn't have to pay for it the next three days. And yes, I thoroughly washed my hands before eating.... I'll never eat, game, stay or recommend Talking Stick Resort again.

Best.Buffet.Ever.... I think those 3 words sum it up. Everything is delicious. I have never seen a selection of dessert so vast in my life. I come here with a game plan... start with cheese appetizers and end my meal with every dessert they have to offer. But my plan always fails. I can't start slow, this buffet is way too exciting. Totally worth the money and better than any buffet I've been to in Vegas. I'd come here every week if I was rich and had amazing metabolism.
Love this buffet.  Food is always fresh, the selection is plentiful, and the price is reasonable.

Really likes this place.   Sure its a Casino and I really dont gamble or drink (at all).  But I was meeting a friend that I had not seen in a couple of years with my wife and its at the halfway from where we both live so it made a convenient meeting point.  Had a little trouble finding it inside as there are no signs but asking someone proved fortuitous and away we went.  We met up, had some tea and hit the buffet.  Great food.  I had some Duck, Pasta, Spinach Salad, Prime Rib.  Definitely went off my diet for this one.  The place was spotlessly clean and the server super attentive.  The only drawback is that we got a bit rushed out at the end of the lunch hour as they were setting up for dinner.    Hey I hadn't seen my friend in years, lots of catching up to do.  But all in all this is an excellent place for lunch and probably dinner as well if their lunch is any indication.  Desserts were great, had a peanut butter pie that was fantastic.  The food fresh and colorful with great flavor and not too many sauces or overdone.    Do yourself the favor and try it out.  Definitely worth the drive.

are 1st time at the Buffett at the talking stick resort!!!! the dinning room was very clean,staff was very friendly,food was very good!! steaks is my favorite!!! when u have friends or family can't beat it. I thinks it's about $20 p.p if u sine up for the players card,it's a $4 discount pp  no 5star because some cakes are dry,

Plain and simple 5 stars of gross very poor quality of food. All the meat was cold and dry. The Asian selection was not very big and unauthentic as was the Mexican food  the noodles in the Asain food were dry. The enchiladas in the Mexican selection were the worst I've ever had. Shrimp gumbo don't bother. Pizza plain thin no taste. Dessert selection was big but looked like it had been sitting out to long nothin was moist. The best things were the mash potatoes and the Caesar salad. I was really disappointed by this place especially inside such a nice casino/resort. The service was great but the food needs to be brought up to Scottsdale standard.

We went here for the Sunday brunch. For $27.95 a person I had high expectations going in.  After paying they have you stand to the side before getting seated. The atmosphere seemed nice. We were seated pretty quickly and asked immediately for our drinks.  The buffet area itself was small, but it had a good selection of items. I won't go into detail about the various items but I will say that there was nothing that wowed me and some of the hot foods weren't even warm.  I thought overall it was okay. I cut buffets some slack generally because it's not that easy to mass produce great food. I probably would not go back unless there was a promotion or something.  The service was lacking. We had to flag down other servers to get condiments.

$12.95 lunch buffet (no fresh seafood offered during lunch).  I've been curious about casino buffets, and with a friend visiting w/ Malaysia, I used this as an excuse to try going on the Loop 101N on our mini AZ roadtrip.    Yes: Prime rib (no casino buffet should be without it plus you get an offering of creamy horseradish or the plainer, intense one) Cheese selections (snob appeal to have a cheese course after my main and prior to dessert) Berries & creme anglaise on puff pastry (this was soooo good, I sat here an extra 15 min relishing this with coffee) 14 flavors of gelato/sorbet (go ahead, that really nice counter lady will kindly scoop several mini tastes into a platter for you...hehe)  AND YES REALLY: Shrimp wonton soup!  I was digging it... but kept quiet cuz really, really?a buffet can make wontons this good?.  Then my Malaysian friend said "this is really good" and I got way too excited for being inside a casino and tripped over to get a second bowl.  Though I'm not sure how this place ranks with other casino buffets, this meal has to be an incredible deal when I kept tabs on how much we'd spend on lunch for the remainder of our trip.

Good buffet.  Not as good as Vegas (not even close), but one of the best buffets in Phoenix for sure.  We went for dinner, lunch and once for Sunday brunch.  I think the Sunday brunch was BY FAR THE BEST.  Unlimited bloody Mary's and mimosas and the food was especially good.  Plus it is inside the casino which is pretty awesome too.  Loved the hotel, stayed there for a few days.  I would definitely recommend this place.  You feel like u r in vegas

My husband and I normally don't like buffets.. period ..but my parents were coming into town and they are older and love the variety and cost of buffets. I checked out buffets on Yelp.com for the Phoenix location. Wandering Horse at Talking Stick Resort kept popping up with good reviews. I read the reviews but was still leery. Sounded like the best time to go was Saturday night. The cost was $25 plus tax per person which included buffet and drinks. Cokes, tea, coffee The menu consisted of prime rib, kobe steak, oysters , salmon and lots of shrimp ,Chinese ,Mexican dishes, soups. Tons of desserts and even banana foster was available if requested.   My plan was to pay for our dinner as we walked through the door so my parents wouldn't notice the $25 charge per person. My Dad somehow pulled out his credit card while I was scoping out a table with my Mom. I could tell by his expression that the $100 plus bill was more than he expected ;-)   The waiter let us pick out our table and we decided on one by the window so we could enjoy the view. The waiter got our drink order and even served me hot green tea when I requested it. The glasses were thin and small but the waiter always came by and asked if we needed a refill. Our dirty dishes were also taken up promptly and new silverware were replaced after we returned from the buffet.  Now for the good part... The food. My husband and I don't eat red meat so I can't speak on that but everything I got was excellent. Salmon, fried shrimp, mashed potatoes, green beans and lots of mini desserts.  Dad stated prime rib was also excellent. I usually think the food at buffets all taste the same and bland but this buffet actually exceeded all our expectations. Actually flavorful. Mom and Dad even agreed that it was worth the bill. I would really like to give this a 4 1/2 star if that were an option.   I would also warn you about the smoke in the Casino.  All I have to say is walk fast to Wandering. horse buffet.   We got dropped off at the front and my husband self parked and got a ride from a hotel provided golf cart driver. The line for valet parking was long and actually it didn't take my husband long to meet us in the restaurant.

Awesome choices for lunch. I love the tuna salad,sauteéd vegetables,tilapia and smoked salmon. Furthermore,they have good varieties of dessert. For $15 of lunch buffet,this is one of the best deal in the casino. My husband and I will definitely go back when we visit Phoenix.

Brunch use to be $28.00 per person!  Upped your prices to $34.00 per person for the same food and since your company is owned by the same as company that owns Casino Arizona no reason to spend that much for a similar menu!!!!  Won't be back here!
Either I was REALLY hungry or that buffet was very good. The macaroons are insane.

Some of these reviews must be from the employees or people that have not had a better casino buffet. Went there Saturday for lunch, and being from San Diego, I can say honestly if you don't want to drive 6 hours to get to Vegas or San Diego then I guess this buffet would be second best. 5 stars is way too high to rate this buffet.  Steaks were like rubber, Asian food was as good as Panda Express, the "gelato" was just basic ice creme, so if you want almost as good then go here. I have yet to find anything in Az as good as Barona, Pala Casino, or Valley View. Guess ill visit Cali more.

This buffet was pretty awesome. We came in for Easter brunch and didn't realize that it was going to be extra since it was a holiday, but we sucked it up.   There was a lot of varieties to choose from.. mexican station, asian station, even a gluten-free station, a bit small but still great that is offered. Seafood was abundant with raw oysters, cocktail shrimp, and crab legs already prepped and cracked for you.   The most awesome part is the huge dessert section (which is a total plus). Lots of different types from cakes, and cheesecakes, sorbet, gelato.. it will make a sweet tooth very happy.  The buffet is very clean and the restaurant is quite large. There are huge windows that bring in lots of light into the restaurant and a view of the property.

Went here a couple times for the lobster buffet and the Alaskan king crab legs. Nice restaurant, good prices for the buffet. The only complaint I have is that the meat of the crab legs and the lobster gets very dry after it had been cut in half by the restaurant, all the juiciness and moist from the seafoods dissipate after if get the final steam before serving to customers. The only reason I'm hesitant to come back here actually. If you are reading this Wandering Horse management, please don't pre-cut your crab legs or lobsters in half, doing so would result in dry, non-freshness meat.
Great prime rib!  Desserts were also very nice.

It's cheap and clean (I'm used to the asian buffets, don't judge), but I was expecting a little more food than that. We had a really attentive waiter, so that's always a plus. Regardless, it's a buffet and I kinda spent most of my time wishing I was in some kind of food paradise living out my wildest dreams, but I wasn't. Oh one thing about the omelet/egg station - I was standing in line to order an omelet but the poor guy in front of me couldn't get his eggs over-easy because the chef didn't understand what he wanted (language issue), so that was awkward but a minor issue regardless. Eggs are eggs. You can't always get eggsactly what you want, I guess.

Buffet is exceptional. Food is really good. Street corn was a treat. Coconut pie one of the best I've ever eaten. Love the peanut butter cookies very hard and crunchy. Love the red skin potatoes with chives and sour  cream .would do this again in a heartbeat.  Prime rib was delicious and turkey breast also delicious

The server, Romelia, was excellent in refilling our drinks and taking away our plates.   In general, the food was very good.   The shrimp fajitas were excellent, and another person in our party said the mashed potatoes were great too.   I would stay away from their Spanish rice... pretty pastie and bland.   Nice selection of desserts too and the ice cream was. Served in little melon scoopers, but were just the right size after eating so much.

I work in Scottsdale a few miles away from Talking Stick Resort.  My coworkers and I go to the Wandering Horse Buffet in Talking Resort occasionally to eat.  Our appearances for lunch have been less and less as of late.  Mainly because of their stupid tipping policy.  At the Wandering Horse Buffet, tips are included for 18% for parties of 6 or more.  This sounds like normal restaurant procedure...except that the lunch buffet servers only take orders for drinks and only refill your drinks.  They don't even take your plates away (the busboys do that).  You get your own food from the buffet and carry it over to your table.  When you enter the restaurant with 5 friends and pay your $15 buffet price, you are sometimes told about the 18% tip (many times it just silently shows up on the bill).  In the times when the cashier asks if an 18% is OK and respond with "No," is when I get rolled eyes, dramatic sighs, and sideways glances to the other waitresses who fold their arms and look away.  It's a guilt trip every time and I find myself suggesting the buffet for a lunch destination less and less often.  I understand requiring a tip for servers who take orders, carry plates, return plates, bring coffee, take the dessert order, bring dessert, close the bill, take credit cards, return cards, etc.  All the servers at Wandering Horse do is bring drinks.  A mandatory 18% tip that requires a fight at the cashier to get removed is ridiculous.  The food is hit or miss and a little expensive, but the tipping policy at Wandering Horse Buffet kills the experience for me.  If they don't fix it, then I'll be wandering somewhere else for lunch.

This place is bookmarked from long and finally I made it today at lunch buffet and found it worthy for the price on weekdays .It is priced around 15$ for each person and they had huge no.of stations .Starting with Asian,Mexican,Pizza ,Dessert ,Salad stations. The one I loved most is the dessert one.   Good thing is they had smoked salmon and tomato basil salmon available on weekday too. I would say they should work more on the smoked salmon and the shrimp soup available. Service is prompt and also they would offer you hot tea or coffee at the end of your meal .  YES !! I am a FAN now for this buffet .

Was here again for the 7th Breakfast Club UYE. I was here in January for the 1st Breakfast Club of the year but that was pre Yelp times for me. That was long long long ago in the before times. I have to say this Buffet is very close to perfect. Lots of food and lots of choices. Pretty much everything you can imagine for breakfast including some Chinese food thrown in. Fruit, cereal, pastries, omelet bar which is the best, BACON, sausage, hashbrowns, breakfast potatoes, fresh cut right in front of you peppered bacon, even Gelato. My only real complaint is that they don't have just regular buttermilk pancakes. They have whole wheat pancakes or they have nuts in them or something. Still good but I would love some regular buttermilk pancakes. I would even take blueberry pancakes. For $10 you really can't beat it. Breakfast Club always has great people at it and good conversations going on. Even for 8 am in the morning this had the biggest turn out so far. If you haven't been to a Breakfast Club you should come out. Go here for breakfast on Friday and Saturday when it is only $10 and stuff yourself. You will not be disappointed.

This buffet is really really really good! The food is fresh and flavorful! It is of high quality. The restaurant has a great ambiance...very modern yet cozy! And the service was excellent and way above standard. Our server Leslie took great care of us and was very attentive to our needs and really made our experience very memorable. We love this buffet and we love this resort. It truly was the level of service we received all the way around that sets this place apart and whenever we are in Scottsdale we will for sure be staying at Talking Stick resort.

I'm not typically a big fan of buffets and this one didn't really change that, but I was pleasantly surprised with how many options were available. Along with the typical buffet offerings (shrimp cocktail, salad, various fried items, etc.) they had goat stew, grilled sirloin steaks, pork chops, two different types of crab, prime rib, mussels, clams, oysters, and a lot more that I could get into. The grilled meats were good as was the prime rib. Plenty of food to go around with the crab tray and steaks fully stocked at all times during peak Saturday dinner hours. The desserts were pretty varied as well, although I didn't try many as I was stuffed from the savory foods.  Wait wasn't too bad, line extended out to the casino with a little bit of a wait to get seated once we paid, but overall it took about 15-20 minutes. I probably wouldn't come more than once a year, but it's a good change up if you want to try a bunch of different things.

Went for Sunday brunch, the price was $18.00 which included the buffet, and two glasses of champagne. The buffet had breakfast and dinner items. I only had the breakfast items (eggs, fruit, bacon, sausage, biscuits and gravy, etc...). The food was good, and the best part was the made to order omelette station. One pleasant surprise was the service; our waiter was excellent. Definitely worth a visit when you are in the mood for a breakfast buffet.   Cheers.

Tried the lunch buffet.  The actual food area is quite small compared to the amount of space for tables.  Over all quality was good for what I tried.  They had a Asian Station, various noodles with shrimp, vegetarian etc.  Didn't try any of it, but did try the Wonton Soup and dumplings.  It was tasty.  Chicken enchiladas were tasty.  Carving station had tri top and lemon chicken.  Did not try the chicken, but it looked good.  Tri tip was tasty and nice medium rare on the inside.  They also had sirloin steaks that were all well done, but they were happy to grill up a medium rare one for me which was tasty.  Blackend salmon was also tasty, melt in your mouth and not overcooked.  Desserts were really good and nice portions.  Meal over all was good.  Sodas, Ice Tea, and Juice was also included.  There is a full bar there too for those interested.  3 Stars is because it's $15 with tax, with tip looking at $18 for lunch which is a bit pricey.  Also you pay before hand which makes it difficult to tip. Having to prepay including tip, doesn't allow to give an extra tip based on actual quality of service, which I wanted to do because service was actually pretty good, but alas I couldn't.  Will come again, but not that often, $18 gets a really good non buffet lunch at a lot of places.  But if I'm craving a nice carving station protein kinda meal, will come again.

Took a friend here tonight for the Christmas Eve buffet. All the food I tried was fresh and very good overall. I had fresh oysters on the half shell, lobster claws, king crab legs, American Kobe beef steak, baked halibut, veal oscar, lamb chop, panang curry shrimp, smoked salmon,. a spoonful of very good guacamole. and a small bowl of seafood chowder.  The crab and the lobster claws were fresh and really excellent, as were the oysters. I really liked the veal oscar and had a second piece. The kobe beef was good but I have had better, still excellent for a buffet though. The halibut was good and the smoked salmon was very good. Lamb chop and the seafood chowder were ok. The panang curry was really excellent.  After eating all this I was too stuffed to try the desserts. Have to go back again to try the cheesecake.   Overall my friend was very happy and I really enjoyed the food so it was a great evening. Cost was $35 a person plus drinks if you order liquor. I stuck with ice tea but my friend had a drink and she said it was very good. Service could not have been any better, pushing on fantastic for a buffet.  Had to wait about 20 minutes to get a table but it was worth it. I'll be back again!!

First time in town for the training. This place is near by the training center and the reviews on yelp were good. 4 stats and 300+ reviews. What can go wrong. How can this place get 4 stars? The foods were dried especially Chinese and pizzas. You can feel it just looking at it. Not much selections. I know it's only $20 per person for the dinner. Then why I gave 2 stars instead of 1? The server was good to earn 1 more star. Other than that. This is worst buffet I ever had.

Y'all might as well plan to have my funeral here on a Sunday during Brunch service.  Although this place isn't big, the variety is always awesome and fresh. If you can't find something you like here something is truly wrong with you or perhaps you're a bit too pretentious? This is certainly the CLEANEST buffet in Arizona and that's important to me. The stations are well attended to and I've never gone on a day where the food wasn't freshly prepared. Please note; they don't always have Crab legs only on Saturday Night and Sunday Brunch service I believe.  Typically, their dinner/lunch spread consists of a salad bar, cheese and crackers, multiple soups, Asian, Mexican, Pizza/Italian, Meat Station, and of course a massive Dessert bar! The last time I went the Dessert attendant was making Banana Fosters on request! Service is friendly and fast, the waiters do a good job of keeping your beverage full. This place is a must try!

Made the mistake of going on the weekend, seafood on the bar equals super expensive.  Especially if you aren't going to eat your weight in crab legs, which I'm not.  Its weird,  I know, I love most sashimi but raw shrimp, crab legs, oysters, and mussels gross me out.  I also don't do mimosas, bloody Marys, or champagne.  I had a bad experience with mimosas, so I don't even like the thought.  If you're into that kind of thing, this is your A number one Sunday brunch spot. Don't get me wrong, I ate until I was miserable.  They have other stuff, like Chinese BBQ duck legs and a range of gelato selections.  I think I tried three or four rounds of gelato.  My favorite was definitely the salted caramel.  If they'd just handed me the bucket of that I would have been super happy, although probably also super sick.  I'm overall satisfied with the quality here.  I thought it was pretty good.  You should avoid the chocolate cake on the dessert bar, though, its got chocolate liquor in it and is disgusting.  Other than that, its all in what you like.  Give this a try.  You won't be disappointed.  Although I would go during the week if I go back, I thought $80 for two was extravagant when neither of us like the seafood.

It ain't the size of a Vegas buffet not even half the size... so chill out. This buffet is aight. I'm giving it 4 stars because in my opinion, it was clean and offered Gelato. Yup. Gelato. The food is eh. Not a lot of variety. Tiny Asian section. Tiny Mexican section. Pizza, pasta, American food, salad, fruit, etc. The usual buffet foods. Oh and about $15 on a Saturday for lunch - that's relatively cheap to stuff your face before they shut down and tell you they're closing the buffet down to prepare for dinner!

Gluttonous and completely delicious...we did the lunch buffet with with my sister & brother in law plus 3 kids (the restaurant was very kid friendly minus the walk past the cigarette smoking blue hair contingency in the slot machine area)....  For lunch, they had a nice selection of prime rib and roasted chicken at the carving station.  Loads of shrimp + salmon and sea bass and a Mexican buffet area.  The deserts were amazing (had to do 1 slice of coconut cream pie and 1 slice of banana cream pie because I couldn't decide).  They also have a very nice selection of gelato.  Overall, it was a Vegas quality buffet for a fraction of the cost ($12.95 per person).

Went on a Tuesday for lunch. $ 13.95 plus tax.   Lots of food options around the following cuisines: American, Italian, Mexican, Asian.   I particularly enjoyed the roast beef--nice and rare.  The mashed potatoes were so good I would trade my newborn child for them (just kidding) Brown gravy and au jus went well with the potatoes.    A variety of salads and desserts --too numerous to mention.  I will tell you there wasn't anything we didn't enjoy except maybe  the chinese fried rice.   A buffet, such as this one, with SOOOOO many options is lost on someone like me who doesn't have an expandable stomach.  I benefited from the choices and certainly I was not shy about eating their chocolate cake.  Cake was really good.  My companion, on the other hand, got his money's worth.   The staff constantly filled our glasses with sugarless iced tea.  Clean place, good service, plenty of good choice though not stellar cuisine.

We came here on a Saturday for lunch for which it's priced $13.95/person. I've been to a lot of Vegas buffets so I wasn't really expecting anything phenomenal. But as I scooted around the buffet, I was b,own away by the variety of cuisines! Asian, pasta, Mexican, pizza, gelato, salads, soups, cheese, ice cream, desserts, meats, and so much more. It wasn't about quantity though, the quality was definitely there and I went back for seconds and thirds and eventually 2 rounds of desserts! Yum! It definitely surpassed my expectations!   We came back on a Saturday for dinner for which it's priced $33.95/person. I was delighted to find that it was a seafood night which meant unlimited steamed crab and lobster!! There were also mussels, clams, shrimp! I was very excited and loaded up on my seafood.  This is a great place to bring out of town guests or for groups. To avoid the long lines or crowded buffet, come during off hours like for a late lunch or early supper.

For a casino buffet, I would have to say this is the closest thing to a Vegas buffet I have tried outside of Vegas. I went here after hiking in Sedona so it was a great place to be after a day full of physical activity. I saw some mixed reviews on Yelp so I wasn't sure what to expect. For $30, this was a great dining experience. They sat my friend and I near the windows, which had an awesome view of the sun setting behind a mountain, almost looked unreal, but it was beautiful. Our server was attentive and very personable--almost ninja like with the refills (there were times I didn't even see him and my glass would be full).   The buffet itself is not the largest (space wise) but there was a huge selection  of food items organized by region of the world. There was a ton of seafood options from cocktail shrimp to grilled salmon to lobster claws. The special of the night was  King Crab and it was pretty tasty. The most enjoyable items were the asian style chicken wings, shrimp linguini, seared salmon, and the cake options.   Even though there were a ton of people there, it was not chaotic. The staff were helpful in organizing the buffet area and kept the food hot and fresh.   Overall, I would recommend stopping here if you are in the mood to feast!

For a price tag of $30/per person I'd say this buffet is OK.  Wandered (pardon my pun) into this establishment after spending the day drinking at the pool party.  We tried to get into Ocean Prime (I think that's what it's called), but the wait was long and with 7 people we knew we would be waiting forever- and we needed food.  At the time a buffet sounded like the perfect option.  I'm pretty sure my Husband would rate this place five stars solely for the large amounts of crab legs he was able to put on his plate.  He absolutely loved it.  I enjoyed most everything I put on my plate.  I especially loved the coconut shrimp, and the romen noodles.  I wish there were some warm dessert options, as the pies and cakes are not my thing.  The steak was good and everything was hot and fresh.  The service was great as well and I liked that drinks were included.  Not sure I would go back considering the high price tag, but honestly all buffets are expensive.  The food quality was good and everything seemed to be fresh, which is super important.  So, if you're in the area and need a quick place with lots of options, this buffet might be for you!

It was alright. $21 for an adult dinner, I was expecting something a little more fresh. It looked like the food had been out for a while. Doesn't look like they change it out very often, at least not during the week, maybe the weekend is better. If you're expecting a Vegas buffet, lower your expectations. Not a lot of variety either. I probably wouldn't come back. Save your money.

we have a new 5 star casino Buffet in the valley and it is great!!! Rand H. and myself went there on opening day and the place was pact at about 11:00 am .I started with a great bowl of soup and then I had a plate of salad items. they had this one macaroni salad that was unreal it was so good it had sun dried tomatoes,feta cheese and barbecued shrimp in it yumm!!!! After that i tried the hot food items that were all excellent. Then it was on to my favorite part, dessert.Well they have quite a selection of mouth watering sweets but the one that really got me was this hot caramel cake. It was so good i went back for more even though i was stuffed   YUMM!!!!!!!

I generally think that casinos offer the best buffets across the country (especially vegas) and the wandering horse buffet is no exception.  I would highly recommend going for lunch during the week for around $12 as the best deal in the valley.  You get a few Asian options, a few grill options, Italian food (pizza and pasta), soups, salad, a few Mexican options, and a huge desert bar.  Of course, they have a carving station with 2 types of meat, and hot grill items which may include some steaks, burgers or pork chops.  At night they add a few more items such as crab legs or other seafood but it is around 90% of the same between lunch and dinner.  Also, check their website for theme nights as well.  They run keno on the TV screens in the dining area and have sports games playing at the bar in the center of the room.  The staff is very friendly and attentive and you can pretty much ask for anything you want and they will get it for you.  If you are into buffets, this is a great one.  If you lose a few bucks in the casino, I'll give you 50/50 odds you can make your money back and the buffet!  ha ha

Ever since the first time I went to Vegas and ate at a Casino Buffet, I've been a huge fan of them! Of course, the variety is the biggest draw for me. Why confine yourself to one item when at a buffet you can have 30+ different things? Well, it was Friday night and Talking Stick came up. Bingo. Sign me up. Wandering Horse Buffet time!  The line there was fairly long when we arrived, but our total wait was only took about 25-ish minutes to pay & be seated. They had the full menu of items posted at the front so we knew what to expect. Our server came by and got our drink order in a short amount of time after we had gotten some food.  Overall, we were happy with the quality of food they were serving. I tried out a variety of items including fried rice, chow mein, & cream cheese wontons, as well as fried shrimp, veggies, potatoes, pierogies, and salmon. While some items were better that others, I did not find any of them to be disappointing which was great. I typically don't like desserts at buffets, but I really liked the freshly prepared bananas foster & gelato here!  As far as the pricing goes, we thought it was fair. We know we will never be able to eat enough to "get our money's worth" since it is $35/per person for Friday & Saturday dinner + Sunday Brunch. It doesn't particularly interest me, but they do offer crab legs during those times and also Champagne for Sunday Brunch. Their pricing for other times of the day is significantly less.  The only reason for minus one star is due to the service. We noticed that they were having a really hard time keeping up with clearing plates. We were given a small 2 person table so it was super inconvenient when we brought back a new plate and our previous one was still on the table. Since the food was good though, we will be back!

This buffet is located inside the Talking Stick Resort Casino... It's pretty fancy compared to the asian buffets that my family loves to go to. It's clean and the ambience is just nice.  But for some reason... I prefer the asian buffet food (Pacific Seafood to be exact) maybe coz Wandering Horse doesn't have sushi.  I love the fact that they have the carving stations of meat! Yumm and a gelato station. They also have really good chicken wings atthe asian station (I don't think it's always there tho)   I just feel like the food here is too bland but my family says it's "healthier" which would make sense... So if you are looking to be healtheir... Here you go!!   This place is not bad tho, still not the best!   Oh and heads up they close lunch at 3pm... The reopen for dinner at 4:30. So no you can't stay there forever!!!   Come for lunch tho! Way cheaper almost the same food as dinner... But I believe they have crab legs for dinner!   Lunch is 13.95 and on weekends dinner is 33.95   3.5 stars!!

I have been here twice now. Once for dinner and once for breakfast. Both were great. I had good service with both a small and large party. Drink refils were plentiful. The food was all tasty...Some of my favorites were the oysters at dinner, the gelato (and yes I had gelato for breakfast!) the breakfast asian food selection was good as well since I am not really that much of a breakfast person! All the stations all seem to be filled quickly when they are getting low and there is a good selection of main items, desserts, fruit, etc. Solid buffet with good staff working hard!

Thanks to yelp found this place while in visiting. My coworkers wanted to try a buffet and this looked like a good place. Located in the Talking Stick hotel and casino. The buffet is around $25 a person. They have several good dishes like the prime rib and the kobe steak, and the shrimp and mussels. They also had pastas, pizza, salad and mexican food.  But the desserts looked amazing, if only I saved room to try it all. Although they may not be as big as some of the Vegas buffets, the quality of the food is above average compared to other buffets. The staff was friend and helpful. A tip to everyone, save some room for dessert.

I wanted to try this buffet because I frequent the Vegas strip buffets often and I wanted to compare. Wandering Horse is definitely one of the top buffets I've tried here in Arizona. It still doesn't rival the Vegas buffets because it doesn't offer nearly half the choices. However the quality was very good in the items I tried. The steak and roast beef was great, cooked tender and seasoned perfectly. The Asian section wasn't good. The "dim sum" dumplings tasted like something out of a frozen package of a grocery store. However, the spicy wings were juicy and full of flavor. I was only here for lunch but would like to check out what it is like during dinner. Service was slow and took a long time just to get water served. A good long walk going through the parking lot and casino.

First of all before I start I am the BUFFET MASTER.  I am the first one to ever review the world famous Buffet of Buffets in Las Vegas, so I know what I am talking about when it comes to Buffets.  I have eaten Buffets from Reno, to Vegas all the way to Atlantic City.   So let me begin.  Buddy hit me up today and said lets go out to eat.  We both were really hungry so I said hey lets go up to Old Country.  He said let treat ourselves and go someplace better.  How about Talking Stick.   So I was down since I have never gone before.    Ok this place isn't that big.  It is about 1/3 the size of Harrah's Flavors Buffet in Las Vegas and about 1/10th the size of Planet Hollywood Buffet in Vegas.  It was 15 bucks for Lunch to get it.  So I was expecting VEGAS or Reno quality.  Honestly I could go item by item and tell you how mediocre the taste was but I will spare you the details of that.  I will sum it up by a couple events that blew my mind.   The first one floored me.  I was standing there next to the Chinese food section and a person asked what kind of sauce was on the Chicken wings.   The Chef then proceeded to reach under the counter and pull out a bottle of General Tso's sauce, I just laughed.   I asked the chef if they made any of the sauces from scratch.  He said nope.  The second and other thing that really pissed me off.  The waiter came to me and said I better get in there and get all the desert I wanted because they were changing over for dinner.  YEP they boot you out.  Unlike VEGAS, or RENO  you actually have to leave.  You cannot stay for the dinner change.   So I went in to find a couple of pieces of cake left.  They tasted worse than Fry's packaged cakes and pies.   It was a joke.  The Ice Cream was average.    In conclusion this place is worth about 6 or 7 bucks for lunch  9 or 10 MAX  not 15.    RIPOFF.  Food tasted like SHIT.   Honestly.  Won't ever go back.   Rushed out of the place, couldn't even enjoy my meal.     Not even on par with Las Vegas and the people on here who are giving it high reviews don't know shit about buffets.

This is easily the best dinner buffet in Arizona. Its comparable to a Las Vegas style buffet. I've come here both times on weekend nights and Saturday they do a seafood buffet with king crab. They have a massive dessert bar, with gelato, pastries, cakes. The Italian section will make pizzas and calzones to order. The Saturday I went they were doing New York strip to order - some of the best steaks Ive had, the mashed potatoes are great and their Latin section had the best paella. All in all, solid place to take a group and great place for steak.

Plate 1: Chocolate donut, strawberries, blue berries, blackberries, pineapple, orange, grapefruit, 2 pork egg rolls, a maple bar and a yoplait yogurt.  Plate 2: steak, sausage, bacon and icecream.  Beverages: Water, orange juice, coffee and a diet coke.  Servers and bussers: SUPERB!  Cost: $9.99+tip on Saturday morning...AMAZING!  So obviously I am not going to become known for my food pairings, but the point is they have all kinds of stuff to meet anybody's desires at the Wandering Horse Buffet.  I think I only tried about 1/4th of all the options available!  It also all seemed very fresh.  The donuts even seemed to be made fresh in house as opposed stale ones that have been sitting around and sourced from somewhere else.  The fruit bar was my favorite.  I was too stuffed for the Mexican breakfast bar and cereal bar, but they also looked appetizing.     I am not really a buffet person, but I definitely left fat and happy!  If you leave this buffet hungry, it is your own fault.

I'm wavering a lot between the 3 and the 4, but they've given me enough great nights with the family so they get the benefit of the doubt. Very rare for me to want a meal enough to wade past a casino full of smoke obscenities for the food.   The lunch pricing is at a fantastic value and you're paying a lot more for the brunch/dinner/holiday packages. You pay first at the register, and as long as you don't order stuff like alcohol that's all you have to pay, besides gratuities for 6 or more. Even on a super packed Saturday with the line out the door, we could seat a party of 10 in about 20 minutes.  There is a great spread of options - Mexican, Asian, pasta/pizza, carving station, salad, dessert, and I'm still probably missing a couple. I do agree with the sentiment that quality is uneven. Carving station has ranged from great to "what is this dry crap I'm eating", the Orange Duck Wing hits a great fusion note, and surprisingly the pizza station is really good! I didn't care too much for specials like the crab legs Friday/Saturday though - it was a mosh pit next to the Asian area and it ranged from cold to soggy after reboiling.   I'm still waiting to try brunch, but I guess I'm pleasantly surprised the casino food isn't just hot garbage. It's close to my house and one of the few places I can get my grandparents to go out.

As buffet's go this is a little hit or miss. The brisket is phenomenal, I really enjoyed the potatoes and gravy and the wide array of desserts. I wish there had been a better salad selection but overall it was tasty.
The food is OK, but the table service could be improved. I guess the focus is on gambling. I don't think we will return anytime soon.

The Sunday Brunch Buffet is worth every penny! There is an amazing amount of seafood, a carving station with ham, lamb and prime rib. There was every type of desert you could think of. Everything we tried was wonderful. The three mimosas that were included were pretty good as well. I'm looking forward to going again soon.

This buffet is about as good as one can possibly imagine for the price.    We didn't realize it until we got there but this place is located in a casino.  I don't really gamble and usually don't feel at home in casinos outside Vegas but this casino wasn't bad.  It wasn't like the typical smoke filled dungeons you see scattered over Arizona.    Also, beware that the buffet closes between breakfast and lunch.  We unfortunately arrived right before it closed for the change to lunch but the staff was nice enough to let us eat the remainder of breakfast quickly.  They were even nice enough to let us stay through the change and into lunch which I was told would normally be an additional cost.    We were treated like kings and ate like kings too!

Clean affordable with excellent food and selection. You will not be disappointed. The food is always fresh And well prepared. Can sometimes get crowded usually on weekends. I have been here several times and it always has been a good dinning experience. The service is outstanding.

They have a great selection of desserts here.   I don't think it's worth the $25 though. I came on a Saturday night. Their buffet consisted of: Cocktail shrimp and raw oysters  Mexican stand Kobe beef/prime rib/leg of lamb Fried shrimp/cod Asian stand Salad stand Pizza   For a buffet, that seemed really boring. I expected more from the Kobe beef.  The pizza stand had four different pizzas. I don't know why you would go to a buffet to fill up on starches.  I could get a better food from an Asian buffet. At least they have a variety of seafood and sushi.   I thought I could leave with a happy tummy if I lost in gambling. Boy was I wrong.

Its good. Legit buffet for $26.95. A little overrated, a little more expensive than your typical buffets, but the food is better than other typical buffets around town. I'll go back if craving king crab or lobster claws because thats what makes the visit worthy... Servers generally sucks(a lot of waiting & constantly having to ask for water & drinks) but the buser is really attentive(always).

As good as it gets in AZ. This is probably your best bet for a Vegas style buffet 300 miles away from Vegas. The line can be horrendous, especially on holidays and weekends. Wandering Horse is by far nothing like home town buffet or Golden Corral.  On seafood nights it's like they need line security for the crab & lobster claw section because people start getting ignorant and act like they don't know how a line works but other than that, it's a very enjoyable buffet. High quality for the most part and very clean.
Delicious. The dessert is wonderful, with fresh crepes and pies made.  Entrees are also freshly made, I love the smoked salmon, prime rib, and all the pastas.
Best of the best buffets with AYCE King Crab, lobster, or prime rib, and some of the best desserts ever.
Long lines for buffet. We waited over 45 minutes for a table of 2 adults.  And it's quite expensive, nearly $75.00 for two people?  Our waitress was excellent!

Excellent buffet food and surprisingly delicious salads! Had to walk thru the smoke filled casino (expected), but once you hold your breath and get into the restaurant, the service and food are excellent.  We were thoroughly surprised by the grilled veggies, as well as the smashing potatoes and tons of crab legs. Overall, we can't wait to go back!

Went with out of town friends for lunch. Go before 3pm to get the lunch price. Amazing selection of foods, everything was fresh. Deli meats & cheeses, salad bar, Asian dishes, steak, pizza, cold deli salads, fresh fruit & crackers. Hand dipped ice cream, tons of sweets & sugar free treats.  Everything was quality and fresh.  Employees were smiling and helpful. Beautiful casino setting. Plenty of covered and valet parking.  I can't wait to come back on a Sunday for the brunch Buffett!

Yoooohoo this place is the bomb! There is so much food and varieties so that there is something for anybody- that's me saying who doesn't eat steak or sea food. But still had so much of the pizza, Chinese, Mexican, American breakfast, and desserts and it was all soo sooooo good. Drinks are free as well. We had juices memosa and coffee. Place is in casino. Very clean ambience, grt service, fresh food and lot of choices. My wife eats both sea food and steak and she said they were also very good. A+++

Food is fresh and well prepared. Service is friendly but do not speak English well. Atmosphere is nonexistent... Like a cafeteria. Smoke smell drifted into the room.   The view from the window seats is awesome.

Food was not impressing. The ambience and the decor of the place is great like eating at a nice restaurant rather than a buffet place. Food on buffet was served on small serving plates with employees standing right behind them to restock them when low. Sort of makes you feel like they are judging you on how much food your serving yourself. Maybe just me but, I don't like buffets like this.  There was not much choices with the breakfast buffet but would like to see about re visiting for a dinner buffet. Was A Ok.

This review is a reflection on the UYE Breakfast Club get together that we all enjoyed so much. Monica O is definitely the Queen of putting together large groups of Yelpers and she does a swell job of making the event fun and exciting.  This is my second chance to visit the Wandering Horse and always seem to have a great time. Brought my wife so I could introduce her to some some of my really cool party animal friends. She always hears me talking about them and this was a fine occasion to take it to the next level.  The food at the breakfast buffet is always very good and fresh. They serve everything that you would need to get your tummy filled up and make your belt buckle loosen on it's own. There is really no reason that you should still be hungry by the time you are finished and leave this place.  Service is always delightful and the place is usually very clean and tidy. Would like to see a faster process up front at the money takers. The line was very long before they opened and it felt like it took forever.  Big shout out to Monica again for all her efforts and time. You are the Best and deserve a gold medal or a new cute badge. Hi to everyone who came and to those to did not make it. Hope to see ya again next time. It's going to be awesome. PARTY TIME!  5 STARS

It was our first time going. We went on fathers day so there was a little bit of a wait. It was way worth it. All the entre choices from the seafood to the steaks,prime rib and rack of lamb all outstanding.  Plus your choice of champagne, bloody mary or mimosa is a sure bonus.

Returned again last night for their Valentine's Day special!  Everything was top notch food fresh and can't beat the variety.  Service was excellent.  Highly recommend. Have the lobster ravioli if available and the parmigiana risotto- heaven!

The food was delicious. Not your typical casino buffet of just fillers. The poached salmon was extraordinary. Roast was perfectly done, mashed potatoes were creamy and tasty. Everything I tried was so yummy. The gelato was almost as good as what's served in Europe.  The desserts all looked so tempting. Cheesecake was good too.  Service was great.  A great buffet experience. Before spending all your money on the slots, this restaurant is a must to try.

Awesome buffet at a great price! I've been to many a buffet -pretty much hit everyone in Vegas over the years. Talking Stick has great service, amazing variety and excellent food! Definitely worth the 20 min drive! A+

My boyfriend and I have been excited about going here for months. Every time we went the line was so long we didn't want to wait.  We finally went Saturday night ...  I have no idea why this place has such good reviews. It's honestly like Golden Corral but with crab legs. And the crab legs were good so if that's what you're going for you will enjoy. DO NOT EAT THE OYSTERS. They small and taste fishy.  We knew this was a big no-no after we ate just one each.   The atmosphere is terrible like a cheap cafeteria and the selection is not good at all. The only thing other than the crab legs that I would eat there again is the bananas foster. Not worth the line or the price!
Top Notch, Great variety including sea food, asian, soups salads, carving station, desert, Gelato/Sorbet.  Really good.

Upon the upcoming of a 2nd The Breakfast Club UYE, I realized I did not write the rave review of the last one as I intended. The mind get's a little slippery with age I suppose! I for one have never been a breakfast person but this was an opportunity to hang out with some Yelp friends and make new ones too, met at The Wandering Horse Buffet at the Talking Stick Resort & Casino. All you can eat and drink for $10.00 sounded like a great deal to me. The food was fabulous! Where else can you get any breakfast food you desire from fruit & yogurt, eggs made to order, fresh cut bacon,fresh pastries, with the baker making them onsite, the list goes on and on. Then to my surprise food of the Asian Persuasion for breakfast, I was in heaven!  As if the first two plates of food wasn't enough, I decided that hey if you can have dessert after dinner and lunch why not have it after breakfast? I had melt in your mouth gelato, a small scoop of pistachio, salted caramel, and caramel cookie crunch, soooooooo good!  I can hardly wait to go back, taking my Aunt when she comes to town and sweat pants!  Wandering Horse definitely converted me into a breakfast person!  Thanks Monica for setting up an awesome UYE and choosing the best breakfast place in town!

This buffet is possibly the best I have ever had. That is really saying something because I have been to Vegas 17 times in the last 4 years.     Thought it would be nice for my mom and I to check out a local buffet so I jumped on yelp and found the reviews for this place. I have driven by here many times but really never noticed it. We went on a Monday night and expected it to be pretty busy. Lucky for us the place was almost empty when we arrived. We were seated at a very nice booth and placed our drink order. At first I did not see where the actual buffet was until I noticed people walking through the archways and into another room. I think that's a nice touch. Makes eating a but more relaxed and quiet.         We walked in and checked out everything before starting to fill our plates. Pretty nice selection. Lots of very nice cold meats and cheeses. These turned out to be very good as I tried several. I tried most everything they had to offer and was really blown away by the quality and freshness. The prime rib was excellent as was the pork chops and especially the duck drum sticks. These were my favorite and I ate my weight in them to prove it.          The deserts were also very good.
