The choices included omelet bar (made to order), fresh fruit, yogurt, granola, eggs, bacon, link & patty sausage, potatoes, chorizo, various pies, donuts, breads, bagels, muffins, coffee, teas, juices, cereals, etc.  There was much more but I can't remember everything.   Prices go WAY up for dinner & weekends, so call the resort to know prices beforehand.

The place. Cant talk about Wandering Horse Buffet, with out mentioning Talking stick casino, its the tall building east of the 101 in Scottsdale. Im glad the people decided to ditch the tents and build a nice building with a golf course around it, and by the way the rooms are really nice with out a big price, if your a local check out  their deals during slow seasons.  Yeah and its hidden as well in the maze of slot machines and black jack tables.  Well for the buffet, no problems here close as you can get to a fancy Casino Buffet in Vegas.  The menu is always changing so keep up to date great specials.  Another tip, the Wandering Horse Buffet also hosts great food for holidays.  As for the service staff, I leave a nice ti. Im being real when I say, I don't tip at all buffets.   For the atmosphere Clean classy casino buffet.  you don't eat in a smoke haze. the seats are nice and comfy if i remember right they have wheels, don't tell me that not fun.    Personally any place that can satisfy a dessert feast after a large meal wins me as a fan.    Anyways casino prices,     * Buffet Breakfast - $9.95     * Buffet Lunch - $13.95      * Buffet Dinner Sunday thru Thursday - $20.95      * Buffet Dinner Friday & Saturday $26.95      * Sunday Buffet Brunch - $27.95      * Holiday Buffets - $42.95  kid prices as well.

We stayed at the hotel during Xmas. The food was okay, plenty to choose from. The soup was yummy. it was Prime Rib special that was good. Pizza a little too spicy. Lots of deserts cakes and ice cream. My partner did not want to come back.

There is no lower star to review this restaurant. NEVER dine here on Holidays from $27 per person on regular days and $67 per person on holidays.  Food poor quality.  Terrible customer service.  First time NO LINE because price was too high.  When we started coming here, food was great and reasonable price.  Call first for price before dining.  They will raise the price during TPC Golf Tournament, Super Bowl, & Holidays.  Buffet in Las Vegas is cheaper & better quality food.

Food is fantastic!  Vast array of salads and desserts.  Three meats at carving station included lamb, ham and beef wellington.   Excellent crab legs and shrimp. Four soups, clam chowder, pork posole, beef bok choy and pork wonton.   Well worth the price, you just have to take it slow.  Service staff very attentive, courteous and friendly.

This place has very friendly and courteous staff as well as a very well maintained kitchen.  The buffet assortment was incredible! Everything was clean and well stocked.  The kitchen staff is actually standing around the buffet to ensure everything stays fresh and clean. This is definitely not your average buffet where food gets gross looking from sitting under heating lamps or where some weirdo grabs food with their hands. I will be coming back often to this buffet!

This buffet reminded me of a smaller version of a buffet you would get in Vegas. Food was fresh and almost made to order, the way they constantly were filling each section regularly. Well worth the trip and a must whenever you're in Arizona.

Have wanted to visit this restaurant for several years based on the reviews, I choose to use my birthday brunch and celebrate here.  First off - Talking Stick Resort is an amazing place, surrounded by wonderful activities (Top Golf, Odyssea Aquarium, Butterfly Wonderland) and staffed by very courteous, helpful and nice employees. Additionally there is a nice club and an awesome concert/pool area that hosts some great shows (Journey, Foreigner, Stevie Nicks, Alice In Chains to name a few.)  Wandering Horse is located past the main casino floor and even though the casino smells like cigarette smoke and burns your eyes as you walk through, the Wandering Horse seems to filter this out completely. They have great outdoor seating and cater to any size group. Call ahead if you have more then 8 people.  It is pricey - $33 a person for Sunday brunch. Unlimited spicy Bloody Marys, Champagne or Mimosas - all were delicious and as soon as your glass is empty, another one is brought to you. Your water is always filled and fresh as well.  The buffet. I wanted to love it. The food looked amazing. There are many ethnic food stations - Asian, Pizza, Seafood, Mexican, Roasted Meats, Breakfast, Charcuterie, Smoked meats/fish and a massive dessert and gelatto island.  The good. The food was not bad. It was not great, but it wasn't bad. It lacked a lot of flavor. The selections seem almost endless. I think even if you tried, you could not eat your $33 worth of food. The desserts were a hit. Full size slices of pie, cake, cheese cake, tarts and many small cups of deliciousness. I am not a sweets fan, but they were rocking on this end.  Pizza is handmade and cooked in a brick oven. Was not bad, was not great. The smoked fish was nice. Some of the dishes on the Asian side (Orange chicken, BBQ duck leg) were excellent. Jalepeno bacon - incredible. Beef Stroganoff - creamy and good. Fried shrimp, butterfly style, tasty.    The bad. You think people never have had crab legs. People pushed and shoved to get into this line. They are brought in frozen and steamed, sliced in half. Some legs were icy. Sort of flavorless. The oysters - steer clear. Even on ice they were warm and tasted heinous. Shrimp was rubbery. The prime rib, it had flavor but was over cooked. You are given a generous portion. The lamb was over cooked. Pork belly or slab bacon was undercooked and so fatty we took a bite and left the rest.   I wouldn't go back here, mainly because I am not a big fan of buffets. I wouldn't say I disliked the food but do not agree with all the "awesome food" reviews. If your a big buffet fan, definitely try this place. The wait staff as well as the chefs are top notch, helpful and will do anything you ask. You feel like your really in a big time Vegas place. Get there early - as it was packed by 11AM on a Sunday.

We went there for the first time to try the Sunday brunch.  Being from California, we love Sunday Brunch buffets and they are tough to find around here.  Anyway, here are my thoughts  Food: The food was outstanding.  Huge crab legs that are split for you.  They will also steam them for you and hot drawn butter available. Shrimp, Oysters, Omelet bar, Asian food, endless deserts, Pizza, etc.  Huge selection. Three glasses of Champagne are included.   Service: We ate at the bar as we did not want to wait in the endless line just to get in.  I don't know if it is always like that all the time, but it looked to be a 30 minute wait at best. Our service was excellent, and same with the people working the buffet.   Atmosphere  This is where I dropped a star.  It is a huge dining room that is quite noisy - almost cafeteria looking.  Nice and clean, but they could use some decorations or something.  Overall we really enjoyed it and I am stuffed on Crab.  I would recommend it.

My friend and fellow Yelper Robyn N. put together a little birthday UYE for me at this amazing buffet.  We were joined by Jeromy H. and Scott W.  And of course my daughter, Claire.    This is by far the best buffet I have been to in years!  Since it was a Sunday we induged in the mimosas and Bloody Mary's they offered with our meal.  Walking into the buffet area was like walking into a food dream.  There was the usual salad offerenings and some different soups. And several different areas of asian food with my daughter's favorite, fried shrimp, as well as my favorite, coconut shrimp.  There was an omelet station, delicious bacon and yummy potatoes.  I had the best salmon I have ever had!  It was like butter and metled in your mouth.  And there was pizza made right there in the pizza oven.  My daughter and I watched and they made her a special pizza of her favorite topping, black olives!  She loved it!  There were so many choices and everything was delicious.    And desert.....omg!  They have a gelato station with about 12 different flavors.  I tried the Limoncello and it was delicious!  There was pie and cake and pudding and cookies.....my daughter was in heaven!!    We had a great time with good friends and delicious food!  I can't wait to go back!

Wooow This buffet puts the 'edible' in incredible. Came in during the Sunday dinner buffet for $22 (minus $4 for spending some time in the poker room). Was worth every penny.. Allow me to walk you through what went down:    Started things off with a full plate of fat and juicy chilled raw oysters with lemon/cocktail/horseradish and a bowl of creamy tomato soup.    Next up was a bit of a taster as I plated a scoop of Korean beef (tasty with a kick but not worth a second go), two saucy duck drumsticks (very delicious), and several steamed shrimp shao-mai ('lightest' tasting I've had of these, five sufficed) from the Asian stir fry section. A quick reconnaissance of the Southwestern corner where I picked up some..meh tasting steak/pork medallions and finally to the center grill station for a grilled pork chop and broccolini spear.. This pork chop could have been THE BEST chop I have ever tasted - the thick, sweet n' savory onion/carrot reduction really blew me away.    Boom, on to the next one while the Patriots and Broncos move into the 3rd quarter almost neck and neck.. I attack the seafood section again, this time its smoked salmon with a scoop of fresh guacamole and a pile of plump cocktail shrimp with lemon and cocktail sauce...Ohh and why not throw on another one of those great pork chops.    Mmm, no reason to slow down now - on to round four! This time I shoot for the freshly hand-carved prime rib with hollandaise sauce and two steamy fried cod fillets with tartar sauce... Just a wee bit more smoked salmon and - you guessed it by now - just one mo' dem pork chops.    Head spinning, Broncos pull ahead into the fourth with a dominating lead.. Dessert time!  - Creme bulee x2 - Blueberry and raspberry tarts - freshly made chocolate filled crepe with strawberry sauce - ice cream/gelato sampler - scoop each of: coconut, banana with peanut topping, blood orange, cookies n cream with few extra oreos - peanut-butter chocolate creme cake - banana foster (by request - made to order) ...    Believe it or not, I went back in but something told me to stop else I slip into a food-induced coma.    tl;dr: wtttffff are you waiting for - try it out for yourself!

Another family favorite of ours.  There is a wide variety of offerings and ethnic cuisines that will sure be pleasing to most people.  I'm surprised that my parents enjoy this place as American food isn't really their type, being from southern China and really set in their routine.  Their dishes change daily and the ones I've tried over my past visits I liked a lot.  I especially like their desserts and always hope that the crème brule and tiramisu are there as they are my 2 favorite desserts.  This is a fine place to take your family to for a meal or for you to take a break from the casino.  I found the price per (adult) person to be a bit steep but quality is there to back it up for the most part.

We had high hopes for this place, it was rated the best buffet in Phoenix by Yelp. I knew it would be a little expensive due to the crab legs... $25 a person. We arrived a little late and waited for over 30 minutes to get in.  I was surprised by the large bouncer like men out front who directed us across the hall where the line started.  We got in and found the food was good, but nothing outstanding, with the exception of the crab legs. We took our time with our meal to enjoy it, but when I went back for desert, I found the entire buffet area entirely roped off. When I asked our waiter, he said "you didn't hear last call?" Since when is there a last call at a restaurant, especially when you pre paid. He brought us a few different pies... All of which were not what I wanted.  I'm really disappointed that I paid over $25/person for this meal and did not leave feeling like I got my money's worth... I really feel like I didn't get what I paid for. You can get a much better deal at Sweet Tomatoes across the street.

The Wandering Horse Buffet is a very good non-Vegas buffet.  We came here on a Friday night.  On weekends, starting Friday nights, the price of the buffet is $26.95.  For children between 5 -12, the price of the buffet is $14.  The food is good for a casino buffet not located in Vegas.    The food is separated by sections.  Starting from the far left as you walk in is the seafood station.  The seafood consists of Alaskan King crab legs, Lobster claws, mussels, and clams with a pesto sauce.  Most of the seafood was pretty good.  They have a carving station.  On the night that we were there, they had a leg of lamb, beef wellington, and a pork roast. The leg of lamb was dry.  The wellington was soggy, but, the meat was pretty good.  The pork looked ugly, but, it actually had a good smoky taste to it.  They had a grilling station where they cooked Kobe sirloin steaks and vegetables.  The Mexican and Asian station didn't look good, so I skipped both of these.   They also had a salad bar, different cheeses and sliced meats.  None of which I tried.  But, it did look good.  For dessert, they had a dessert station with about 10 different flavored gelatos.   They also make crepes and bananas foster.  All manned by an impatient Chinese (Mandarin) woman.  She must've been lonely because she started speaking to me in Chinese.  It wasn't until I started conversing with her that her impatient attitude changed.    Our waitress was pretty good.  She did a pretty good job clearing our plates, and kept our cups filled.  The only interesting thing all night were the fighters that came in here to eat.   There were going to have some kind of tournament in the hotel.  Some of them looked pretty rough.  Overall, it was a good experience with good food and good service.  Definitely would be back if we went to Scottsdale again.

We have been here over a dozen times, this is our food-splurge spot!  It is not a splurge in terms of money, especially during the week when it is an absolute bargain.  Granted during the week there aren't quite as many choices but there is always a couple of carving stations, some seafood options and almost always those huge gorgeous oysters.   The buffet is always well stocked (you don't even have to wait for them to bring out more crab legs on a Saturday night!), tons of food and dessert choices and the servers are great. Get there early, the line gets serious by 6pm.

I came for the prime rib buffet tonight.  When I got to the kitchen they had run out of prime rib....seriously.  When I asked for a manager, an attractive but completely apathetic woman came over.   I explained the issue and she refused to do anything about it.  I suggested that as a consumer I would like what I paid for and believe a voucher would be in order.   She refused. So now this buffet has my $22 and this review.   I am a consumer rights lawyer so this ain't over yet.

I think I'm going to need to knock several stars off my previous review:  Recently, at a busy non-holiday Sunday brunch, we arrived about noon to stand in an immobile line, only to make our first round of the buffet about 1:45. And shortly after 2pm the offerings begin to dwindle significantly. Not only did the food dwindle, so did the champagne, with servers abruptly discontinuing beverage service about 2:15pm.   At another recent weekday lunch, I though the buffet offerings were a little pedestrian, and some things were decidedly less well prepared than usual. To make matters worse there was a large group meeting of some sort going on in the corner of the dining room, where there was public speaking, tributes, awards etc.  Why would the casino not make this group get a banquet room? It was so great to overhear someone speaking about a member's tragic death from cancer while I was trying to enjoying my lunch--NOT!  Management at this restaurant needs a wake-up call.

Top of the line buffet. It rivals some of the best in Vegas. We've been there for lunch, dinner, and Sunday Brunch. All were great. The lunch buffet was a great price ($13.95), for a fabulous spread. Dinner was delicious as well ($20.95 week days). The real star is Sunday Brunch .   Mimosas or Bloody Mary's including in the $27.95 price tag.They have a salad bar, international offerings, an omelet station, spicy boar bacon (family members love this!),  cheeses and antipasto, pizza, pastas, an array of desserts, and a full gelato bar.   It's beautiful, it's clean, fresh and out of this world!

First impressions are always the lasting ones. When you go to the end of the line to as for people tyo sit ast the bar instead of asking those of us that have been stand in here in line for 30 minutes you are a POS Restaurant. Makes no difference how good thee food is my impression is you care nothing f or the people waiting. 4 times now we have been passed up as they goto ther end of the line to ask for people for the bar seating. It is absdolute B.S.  Will not return.

would give it 5 stars, but, the sugar free dessert, I think it was supposed to be a mousse, was simply not edible. Everything else... amazing. Shrimp, mussels, clams, salmon, it was a low carb eater's paradise. All fresh and delicious. The buffet was beautifully maintained, and really a surprise to find such fine dining in a buffet setting. So, I'm going to suggest that with all the other really wonderful foods they offer, maybe they can improve on the sugar-free so I can top off my meal!

What a deal, $13.95 per adult and $8.00 per child at lunch.  11-3 Monday-Saturday.  We enjoyed the lunch pricing and enjoyed a $47 bill for 2 adults and 2 kids.  What a great lunch.  Where else you going to eat for such a low price and eat white truffle oil infused ravioli, duck pot stickers, duck legs, prime rib with Au Jus sauce, mash potatoes and gravy, shrimp, oysters, scallop low mien, pistachio gelato , cheese cake, apple pie, banana cream pie, and plenty of other deserts that I could no longer look at.  Delicious calories waiting for me to fill my belly.   Seriously I almost ate all of that at lunch.  This buffet totally blew my diet and it should with so many great items on the menu you should find something that you will like.  In fact you should like it to the point that you will have to loosen you belt a notch to make room.  This could be the best buffet in Arizona, I have to agree with Rand H. on that one.

Hands down the best buffet in Arizona. Seriously!  I tried the sirloin, roast beef, shrimp, mussels, mahi, and pork. All were well prepared and fresh. I also saw crab legs, salads, pasta, pizza, and calamari. They have a ridiculously large desert selection too! The atmosphere is very modern and open, with an optional outdoor patio.  It helps that this is in the new Talking Stick Resort & Casino, which offers several other upscale restaurants to explore. *Check out the 15th floor bar while you're here.

Mothers day brunch was okay but not amazing.  If they charged less than $55 a head, it would have got an extra star.  1 Star for movement and organization of the staff.  It was a very long line but we made it up front in about 30 minutes.  Bussers and servers worked very well as a team to get plates cleared, get people out and people in.    1 Star - The desserts.  I am not a dessert man at buffets.  I do not have a sweet tooth, but this place rocked the desserts.  I was impressed with the selection and care the dessert makers had with their dessert.  Negative star for the layout of the buffet.  Omelette station in the middle of the dessert bar?  I totally missed it and I really wanted some eggs.  No butter by the crablegs and lobster?  It was on the other side of the bar and not labeled.    Negative star for putting shitty lobster on the menu.  It was practically unedible.  I have no idea how to describe it.  It was like overcooked then flash frozen then reheated in a microwave then chilled.  Definitely the lowest point that was our biggest selling point for going.  Bottom line, Mothers Day 2016?  No way Jose.  Random Friday night if I am gambling and have an extra $60 to spend on dinner?  Sure!
The Best Crab Buffet in the Valley Period! Everytime I've Been We Have Enjoyed it All! The Dessert Bar is Fabulous Also! And Worth Every Penny!
Meh. 2.5 stars.   3/5 for service. Very pleasant waiting staff but the servers rarely visit the table to refill water, etc.   2/5 for food. Decent amount of variety but the quality/taste is subpar.

There's no question about it, the buffet food here is phenomenal and top notch. Lots of variety, fresh, colorful, tasty, everything to please the most discerning or picky palates.  The atmosphere is great except maybe for the smoky smell from the casino but that usually doesn't bother me.  Waitstaff are always available and friendly.  If you want top notch buffet food at a great price (about $15/person), then this is place to come!

Been here a few times, probably one of the best buffets in the Phoenix area. The fact alone that they now offer 4 gluten free desserts would make me a fan but the food and the service is always spectacular. Went last night before the Toto/Yes concert (both were awesome) and stayed overnight. My only disappointment was the lamb, which was not up to snuff last night as in the past when it simply melted in your mouth and was oh-so flavorful. Aside from that the sirloin steak was great, the shrimp cocktail, the oysters were delish. Last night they had crab legs and that was quite popular. I don't do crab because it's SO MUCH EFFORT for such little meat, lol, imo. There are many things that someone with food restrictions can have. Also if you step up and ask, the chef will either make some things for you and/or guide you to what you can safely eat.  Wednesday night is Prime Rib night and that's always good too.

I come here for brunch on special occasions. This occasion was my birthday, and  I love their crab legs and eggs Benedict. Today all the eggs Benedict's were cooked all the way through which is not good.  It's sopose to have a runny egg-yolk.  So I asked the waiter to see if he could do something. Eventually the cook came out and we chatted. He made me an eggs Benedict by hand w a very nice runny egg yolk on top of Canadian bacon and English muffin covered  in hollandaise sauce. It made my day much brighter.  Never had the issue before. But they were super nice about it and I appreciated what they did.  Also had a Bloody Mary, which are so good here.  Lots of variety of foods and some of the options change from time to time keeping things fresh and new.

Nothing special and sub par quality   This a TERRIBLE buffet at dinner time considering the price. The wait can be horrendous and the food options are nothing better than a Golden Corral. If your crazy about crab legs go to an Asian buffet for 12.99 and save yourself some money.

One complaint! There needs to be a main dish for vegetarians! There are many of us who visit. Quiche or enchiladas or lasagna or SOMETHING without flesh in it would be very appreciated. Without it, it's pretty slim pickings. Great cheese plate--however one cannot live on vegetables and cheese plate alone.

Went last Friday night. The line was VERY long of course, but people were seated quickly. For two people we paid around $70 (Eek!).There was a lot of different foods to choose from, chinese, steaks, deserts, etc., but they were all very bland tasting. Even the crab puffs seemed overcooked and were hard to chew. One of the deserts tasted how sunscreen smells. I feel ripped off for the price paid but I knew it was a risk like gambling.

Kudos to the omelette maker and the waitress! However, I'm not sure why it was so difficult for four hostesses to find me a decent table.   Overall the food was okay, not that great of a selection for $30 per person though......the bread table had a great display, but was inevitably just there for looks and stale.   I'm a vegetarian and tend to look for healthier options like fruit and a nice salad bar which was not offered.  I don't recommend this place at all. The cigarette smell from the casino seriously kills the appetite.

Sunday Champagne Brunch is pricey for what you get in my opinion.  I started out at the salad bar and the king crab legs and shrimp looked soooo appetizing however they had no taste.  It was kinda like eating tofu if you know what I mean.  I tried the Mexican fare however, it was horrible.  The homemade tortillas were dried out and hard as a rock, the rice was indescribable and the beans were edible but not great. I love green chili but not here!  Yuck!   The tamale was fantastic!  Prime rib was flavorless unless you add Au jou sauce.  The desserts are truly amazing however, they used to offer mini ice cream cones that they no longer offer and we totally miss.  They also now limit you to 3 glasses of champagne which if the food sucks they should fill it up and then you wouldn't care.  Anyway, with the selection, you can find something you like but plan on wasting alot of food to find it.  It used to be fabulous but it was really lacking this visit.

This place is AMAZING. Better than Bellagio for half the price and in Phoenix.  Crab claws, prosciutto, wild boar bacon, the best gelato ever with many non-dairy options including prickly pear gelato.  The only minuses were new potatoes weren't done quite right. It seems like they fry them without pre-boiling them and the eclair was ok but the filling wasn't very good compared to Eclair in Europe. Still better than the Awful monster Eclairs at AJs though.

For a buffet dinner it is $34.95 for seafood buffet.   It is pretty expensive! But the king crab legs seem pretty fresh and tastes good when you're eating it. They also have lots of oysters that were yummy with lemon, salt and pepper and marina sauce. I ate about 6 of them! And a lot of king crab legs.  They have a huge selection of dessert and even gelato. You can order banana foster as well.   I rated this buffet 3 stars because it came out the other end right away! (TMI) I know, sorry!  That's just me, I have a sensitive stomach.
Quality Buffett. Go for Sunday brunch if you want the good stuff.

IM A FAN!  This buffet is inside the Talking Stick Resort and Casino. If you park in the West Parking structure and walk across the breeze way your will be pretty close to the buffet entrance.   I was a little hesitant to try this buffet because of their steep weekend prices (~$45/adult; thats like a Vegas Casino Buffet!) but we tried it on the weekday because its a little bit cheaper during the weekdays. Wednesday nights are prime rib night for ~$20. In all honesty, $20 for the variety and food that is offered is a great deal!  They have 7 different sections: Salad, Asian, Meat carving, Mexican, Raw seafood, Italian, and dessert. The Asian section was actually pretty yummy. It tasted A LOT better than your regular $7 Chinese buffets. It included fried rice, noodles, stir fry with muscles and clams, chicken wings, duck, egg rolls, cream puffs, and soups. It was mostly Chinese food, so I do wish there was more of a variety. The Meat carving station included prime rib and ham. Not too shabby. Mexican and Italian sections were both small but had the usual. Wednesday night also included shrimp cocktails and raw oysters! I was surprised. The dessert had a HUGE variety. from 10+ different amazingly delicious gelato flavors to pies, cakes, mousses, tarts, brownies, and cookies.   For $20 I will come back again; but I can't imagine what else they would serve for double the price!   Environment: 5/5 Food: 4/5 Price: 4/5 Service: 4/5

After 3 years of living in the Valley and searching for a nice buffet, I've finally found what I consider to be the BEST buffet ever!  Was heading to Peoria from Fountain Hills and decided to try this based on other Yelp reviews.  I wasn't even gambling and didn't have any drinks, so my review is purely based on my love of good food. I arrived around 10:30 to find the enter section roped off, and I was told lunch starts at 11AM (not sure if this is a Labor Day only thing as the signed states 10:30 AM for lunch).  Decided to walk around the casino as this was my first time at this one. Much nicer than Ft. McDowell for sure!  Could hardly even smell the cigarette smoke which was very surprising.  After coming back around 11AM we were the first in line and the line behind us grew quickly.  I was impressed by the upscale ambiance as even when other buffets try, they still seem dirty, smelly or just average at best.  After paying just under $30 for 2, a professional server came to take our drink order and we entered the buffet room to find a nice assortment of Italian,  Chinese, Mexican, as well as other various cuisines. Very nice ssortment.  Tried the pesto ravioli which was amazing, brick oven pizza, seasoned curly fries,  fajitas w/fresh warm tortillas.  Everything I had was delicious.  I will say there was a nice assortment of seafood which I did not partake in.  The dessert bar was to die for!  Tried lemon tart, ice cream, red velvet cake which were all decent.  Chocolate chip cheesecake was great too.  I will definitely be going back as there as numerous items I would like to try such as several pasta salads,etc.  There is defnitely something for everyone here!
Not much variety, potatoes are not very good. Cups smell like dog. The French toast is ight.
The food was great and our server was really nice! Cashier was unfriendly and standoff-ish, kind of like she didn't want to be bothered. I would still recommend this place.

This IS a buffet, so I review it as a buffet and in comparison to other buffets, and not as a 5 star steak house. But for a buffet, this place is gooood. I've been several times for both lunch and the Sunday brunch.  Let's start with the service, you pay when you enter and are then seated. You have a server who brings you drinks and others clear plates as you dine. Everyone I've encountered is pretty friendly.   From there, you are free to get up and visit the actual buffet as many times as you want, obviously. I will give them five stars on food variety. They've got pizza and pasta, soup and salad, Mexican, Asian, carving stations, cheese and fruit, smoked salmon and more. In the middle are all of the deserts, which are the best part. Many kinds of gelato, cakes, pies, cookies, pretty much anything you would want. All are part of the lunch spread. For the Sunday brunch, they add crab legs and some other extras and have a little more variety with desserts and sides. Sunday brunch also comes with mimosas or bloody Mary's, those type of drinks.   Most of the food is pretty good. Some dishes can taste more cafeteria than fancy restaurant, but nothing I've had is ever horrible. You go for the variety, experience and all you can eat value, not necessarily the best damn food you've ever had. I will say though, their mashed potatoes are BOMB.   I've never been for dinner or special occasions with have an elevated price, so I can't comment on if that's worth it, but for around 15 bucks for lunch and around 35 bucks for brunch (with drinks) I think it's definitely worth the occasional trip.

Very disappointed with Sunday brunch today. It had been about 1 year ago since I went the first time. I wad impressed by the choices of meats... Like 5 different types of bacon, including wild boar. 5 different types of beef. 5 different types of pork, including wild boar. You get the point. They also offered unlimited mimosas. Price was $30 per person. Today, the price went up and there was less choices. Like any typical buffet....one choice of beef, one chicken, one pork. Oh, and no more unlimited mimosas. You have a limit of 3 amongst  bloody mary's, mimosa, and champagne. I used to recommend people to come here for Sunday brunch. Before, it was worth it. Not so much now. Now, it's just an overpriced buffet. Definitely not impressed 2nd time around. Oh yeah, and if you have a party of 6 or more, they automatically add gratuity. Even if the service sucked. Definitely telling people to go somewhere else.
Great quality food, the king crab legs and firewood pizza was a hit. The desserts was great l!

We went here for dinner last night.  The price was $26/person.. not bad considering there are raw oysters, big shrimp cocktail, sea bass, salmon, duck drumettes, Prime rib, ribs.  It is not the largest spread I've been to like at the Rio in Las Vegas, however, it is not as pricey either.. Surprisingly the stone oven baked pizza was awesome.. they had one with wagyu beef on it that was really good.  Service was extremely attentive, the staff very polite, and the food was consistently being replaced.  In fact, I was reaching for some grilled asparagus when the server behind the counter told me to leave that and he would have some fresh grilled asparagus for me to take instead... This is one of the cleanest buffet's I have ever been to as well.  If all you are looking for is a huge buffet and you don't care about the quality of food this may not be your place, however, I found the selection to be more than sufficient... oh did I mention they have gelato.. really yummy gelato..?  Good buffet, I would recommend.

C+ is the grade I  am giving the Wandering Horse Buffe at Talking Stick Resort. The "+" is for the excellent service. The C is for the average quality of the food despite its vast selection.  Furthermore, I disagree with some of the other reviews that this buffet rivals some of the best in Las Vegas...as that could not be further from the truth. I thought the quality was just okay, and some of the displays looked downright unappetizing especially some of the Asian selection..  $ 27.95 per person excluding gratuity may seem like a bargain for a Sunday brunch buffet but I can't say I was blown away or anything. It was my first visit there and I guess I expected more. The service made quite a difference in the overall experience as I must say that Faye was wonderful and did not miss a beat in keeping us happy and kept the champagne coming (three glasses per person maximum).  The dining room was quite busy however and I assume The Wandering Horse Buffet is a popular destination for Sunday brunch. In conclusion, I was not impressed hence my rating of three stars.

i won some money on the slots and i treated my husband and I to the sunday brunch today. I sampled the shrimp, kobe steak, few breakfast items, yummy mini desserts and of course the mimosas.  loved wandering horse atmosphere, it's a modern and open restaurant. i was impressed with the large buffet offerings!  everything was delicious and fresh. it's comparable to the nicer vegas buffets.  It's too much food to eat in one sitting but It's so worth trying your favorite items.
came here for the holiday buffet It was kind of a letdown from all the hype from the holiday menu  the seafood was good meats ok other ethnic sections were mediocre

This review is based on breakfast only, but I'll update it after I try more meals.  As my 15 year old son would say, "This buffet is BEAST!". I ate here on a Monday at 9:30 and it wasn't terribly busy. Breakfast is around $12 (incl. tax) and you get beverages as well. The food quality is really high and being a buffet, it eliminates the "Do I choose savory or sweet?" dilemma I always face at most breakfast joints. You can have it all as long as you have stomach space!  The fresh fruit all looked really good and the pineapple and grapefruit I had was great. The blueberry pancake wasn't the best, but the waffle with butter and strawberry sauce was killer. I must eat more of that next time! I am not a huge fan of sausage links, but these were quite good, and the bacon was cooked PERFECTLY. So were the hashbrowns and potatoes. I did not care for the peach smoothie at all, but that was the only thing I didn't like.  The wait staff was friendly and efficient. We will definitely come back!

Went here with my wife and 2 kids for my birthday dinner. They serve several different cuisines and I tried a bit of everything. We were pleasantly surprised how good the food was. Among the highlights were crab legs and lobster claws. Lots of people were getting platefuls of these, but at no point we're they even close to running out....they just kept it coming. We will definitely be back.

Can't beat the huge crab legs! And open seafood bar with oysters mussels and clams.   Parking: it's a casino so there is a huge parking garage.   Service: because we were in such a large party, we had great service. They were attentive and really quick to refill drinks and that crab! The venue is nice and clean. Probably the cleanest buffet I w seen. They're really attentive.   Food: the best thing I ate was the crab legs and the beef Wellington and the ice cream! The crab leg was a bit cold and salty but it was super good and filling. The beef Wellington was bomb. I mean I didn't eat too much of the pastry part but the beef was cooked perfectly. The other desserts were not good but the ice cream was awesome.  Specifically the banana dulce de leche ice cream.   Super yummy crab and ice cream!

It's Monday and I am still stuffed...maybe that will resolve itself through the course of the day today...we'll see.  I had clients in town yesterday (and they are friends, as well...always nice to do business with friends:) and they wanted to see the new casino at the 101 and Indian Bend and have brunch...all in all, excellent ideas!  The casino and resort (which has been under construction since I moved to town) have really turned out nicely (at least the portion that is finished...some of the landscaping, pools, finish work inside...well, about 80% of the resort is done...so they have that going for them:) is really very lovely...2 or 3 giant steps ahead of what I expect from a local casino (we aren't in Vegas, after all!).  The important pieces are done...and by important, I mean the pieces that make them money!...the rest of that stuff is just for show.  The casino itself is very nice for a local casino...the restaurants are open and going...they actually serve Peet's coffee here (if you are a Bay Area transplant, you'll know what that means:) and the staff is super accommodating!  We showed up for brunch on Sunday at 11:30 and there was no wait to get a lovely table near the window so we could look down on the construction of what will become a desert nature walk area (probably kind of "Disney" version of desert and native American life...lots a dirt and concrete right now...should be nice when they get it done:)  The dealio seems to be essentially unlimited champagne, bloody mary's, blini's, and mimosa's with brunch...for $25 a head...and given the quality of the food...and the quantity of the food and drink...that's a terrific deal:)  We sat there (well, sat and ate, went and refilled, repeated as directed) for 2 and  1/2 hours...the place wasn't busy and it seemed we had our own wait staff making sure that our drinks were never dry and that dirty plates never piled up...in short, assuring us of a wonderful time:)  I have sampled a few breakfast buffet brunches around town over the past few years, from the Phoenician to the Fairmont to Eagles Nest to the Wrigley (The Beautiful Carin loves no meal quite so much as a Sunday Champagne Buffet Brunch), and I can tell you that this place measures up in every way...and exceeds many of those much more expensive brunches!  * The food is presented so appealingly...on porcelain instead of in steam trays! * Chef's at the ready for any special request (if you don't care for the pizza that is available, they'll make whatever you want...no extra charge:) * Gelato, as well as pastry for your sweet tooth:) * Fresh shucked oysters on the  1/2 shell...on ice...with all the accouterments! * A grill next to the carving station (you want your prime rib with grill marks on it?...no problem:) * You want sushi fresh cut, or a fresh stir-fry for your meal...they whip it up while you wait...wonderful!  The buffet is laid out much like the Wynn in Vegas...tucked behind the massive bar and easily accessible, but not in line of sight, so you can enjoy your meal('s)... without all the clanking, cooking, and other things that often accompany a buffet.  None of that would matter if the food and drinks were crap...but they aren't crap...in fact, the food and cocktails were terrific!  I talked to several of the chefs and told them how really good I thought this place is and they just beamed with pride...they are having a good time and making some good chow and it shows in every bite:)  And for me, the bites kept adding up...I didn't find anything that wasn't tasty (and I ate pretty much everything:)  The good news is that I was wearing my "eatin pants" so I was ok right up to the time we dropped my clients off at their hotel...then it was all I could do to drive home and drag myself to the couch...moaning...in pleasure (no, food pleasure...I couldn't have done anything else:)  Even Carin needed a nap Sunday afternoon (in spite of eating a much "healthier" brunch than I did, with her special request stir-fry and what have you)...those champagnes glasses do add up:)  It looks like Sunday has become "Brunch Day" once again, now that a good one is so close...and so reasonably priced!  Now I just need to figure out a new workout program that will allow me to deal with the extra 12,000 calories every Sunday:)

I came here for Sunday brunch with Sarah H and Dan H and it was glutinous.  It can easily compete with a Vegas buffet.  Three kinds of smoked salmon, crab, shrimp and sushi just to name a few of my favorites.  It is well worth the $30 price.

This buffet is quite wonderful! The place is classy & clean. The food has a wide range of fried, baked, healthy, & sweet options for breakfast, lunch, & dinner. The ambiance is comfortable & pleasant. I look forward to coming back.

Wanted to give 5 stars, but the buffet on a Saturday night featured no crab legs, just jumbo shrimp and oysters for a seafood buffet?  Service was great, I have to admit. The prime rib was tender and tasteful, leg of lamb was also yummy. The buffet overall was a great buffet, I think I need to try out the sunday brunch to get the full experience.

Wife and myself had dinner here tonight. Lots of variety of food. Some hits some misses. Quality is no better than good but nothing was something to remember or bring me back. It was underwhelming. Decor was clean cafeteria with some padded booths. At $21.99 per person for dinner you could do much better two milies away. It would not keep me at Talking Stick for food or to gamble. That is what a restaurant should do at a resort. This place does not.

Absolutely amazing dishes!!!  I don't know what's more impressive,  the food or the service.. We've been here on Christmas Day,  birthdays,  family get together and just because... So much exquisite food to choose from.. Make a point to come here for a really nice dinner.

If I could rate this with a negative star I would. Since this opened around 2010 we went several times a year.  We loved it. They had some amazing items and pretty reasonable. As time went on things started changing.  Lamb chops only lasted about a year and quality started lacking.  I know things go up in price but at the beginning it was $19.95 for Friday & Saturday, now its $33.95. We went there yesterday  (6/21/16)   It was absolutely horrible.  NEVER GOING AGAIN.  My favorite is oysters and I'm sure they were spoiled because they tasted really really bad.  I have bad stomach pains and diarrhea till 2 in the morning.  Soup was gone and nobody refilled, nothing looked fresh and this was at 7 pm and everything else had been sitting for a long time. Well I guess they have their clientele and don't care about quality.

If you are looking for variety of food dishes, wandering horse buffet is the place to visit. It has different types of cuisines, which are available such as the Mediterranean, Latin, Asian and American. The dining options, which are available for the public, are the buffet and breakfast/brunch. You must be prepared to eat a lot as there are dishes, which are really mouthwatering. Above all you would not find this place expensive at all with reasonable price ranges of all the dishes. The price range of this place is around PKR 980 to PKR 2939.  People find this place really attractive not just because of the food it has to offer but also because of the other indoor facilities that are available here. There is the option of outdoor seating as well if you are not interested in sitting indoors. The feature of wandering horse buffet includes the carving station, fresh bar of salad, lively cooking stations, pizza kitchen that is brick oven and the delectable desserts as well (Jenny, 2014).  It has been a great experience visiting this place because of the variety of dishes this place offers. If you are here for seafood you must try the sea food. Although the crab legs are salty it is worth giving a try.  If you are looking to have a breakfast here you will find a variety in it as well. Except for fresh berries, which were available in variety, there were numerous varieties of dried fruits as well. There were 2 kinds of sausages, Mexican items, carved ham, Chinese items group of dim sum, Asian vegetables/meat combos, congee and oatmeal, pancakes, French toast and waffles. There were some of the breakfast items which were regular ones and that included the scrambled and hard boiled eggs, omelet station, pastries, and different kinds of potatoes, cold cereal and yogurt. The gelato station is already set during the hours of breakfast.  You can find an array of desserts, which includes different kinds of cheesecakes, numerous pies and gelato bar. In lunch you can have the American, Mexican and Chinese buffet items, four different types of fish, unusual crackers and cheese chunks.  The service of this place will also inspire you. The room provides with beautiful scenery. The price factor might be an issue for many. The breakfast costs around $9.95 every day except for Sunday. There will be certain changes in the price as per the notice, which was seen when I visited there. The price will be increasing to $14 by the end of the month of March. This price increase will be from breakfast-brunch.  It will be still good considering the time length will be increased from breakfast-brunch (Elyse, 2014).  If you are not a smoker, this is the place to have a great meal without any smell of smoking. The decoration is really impressive except for just having the variety of food. You can easily try those expensive lunch items for around $15, which includes the drinks you prefer. It must be remembered that if you are dieting this is not the place for anyone to visit. If you are planning to visit this place on weekdays you will surely get the value for your money. There are plenty of selections available for you in just 21.99, which include the sliced beef, pizza, ribs, pasta, oysters, shrimp, sirloin steak and Chinese chicken (Elyse, 2014). There are numerous desserts, which you can also try.  You can also have those desserts, which are sugar free ones. The staff is really friendly and attentive. You can also book a room which must be king sized one. The room is really spacious and also the beds which are really comfortable to sleep on.  The shower area is also very good and large one where 2 people can easily take the shower at a time. There is a WIFI, which is also available in the rooms. It is really speedy in terms of browsing or uploading some of the pictures on face book. There are few problems, which can be encountered. Although the view of the pool is really nice from the room but it is really noisy with the noise reflecting. You can still sleep comfortably after the midnight as the pool is empty and no one is around there. There is lot of noise on the weekend but besides that the midweek is really peaceful. The valet parking service is also free of cost with many spaces available for self-parking. The service provided is excellent. The hotel persons are really polite, wonderful, prompt and courteous. The bell service is also provided to pick up the bags the moment when you open the door of the car. The bell service is required because they don't keep any baggage carts for the guests. The hallways are really long and you do need someone to help lift the bags (Lucky, 2014). Overall, the wandering horse buffet is an excellent place to visit and you must give a try to the variety of food that is available here.

I don't get the hype. I mean it was at best "okay". Perhaps I went on the wrong day (Mother's Day) where they raise the price $20 a head. Cost to value was not justified after having brunch. Even on a normal day, I'm still not sure it's all that great for $30/ person.   This may be one of the better buffets in Phoenix but that isn't really saying much. The thing I'll give them is great service, comfortable atmosphere, wide selection. Creme Brulee was top notch. That I will brag about.

My wife and I tried this place on a Tuesday evening.  We were both pleasantly surprised.  This has to be one of the better Casino buffets in the Phoenix area.  Seafood, Chinese food, Mexican food, salads, soups, steak, sandwiches, pizza, and deserts a good selection for the meat eater and vegetarian alike.  It was well presented and fresh.  The staff were attentive and never let our ice tea get empty.  As long as you can regulate yourself and not eat to much you'll enjoy this place.

We came here for lunch and I was disappointed after reading some stellar reviews.. The food was very bland and our server barely ever bussed our table. There was a lot of things that said "unavailable" at the buffet and when our server first asked us if we wanted to drink (the second i pulled my chair out .. Not even looking at the menu!!) I told her water for now and she didn't return for 45 minutes. Just because you immediately harass me prior to even sitting at the table doesn't mean i don't want something to drink after i have had a minute to look at the menu. Ridiculous.  The chefs there to cut food when i asked KINDLY if i could have a slice, asked how their day is and immediately was returned with a WELL IM HERE, YOURE THERE, AND ITS NOT CHANGING ANYTIME SOON CAUSE I HAVE BILLS TO PAY. wtf teach your chefs/servers customer service... Are you not paying them fair wages and are they constantly mistreated? This is the message your staff is giving to clients. Its unprofessional, aggressive and insulting. Completely changed the energy of a celebration of our anniversary. Which i spent a crap ton on a room due to spring training (3x the amount I pay in vegas for EXCELLENT rooms and free buffets). Extremely disheartening. Some of the food was tolerable (im being nice to those of you that have a decent palate, nothing i have a desire or craving for again.  I generally left disappointed and felt bad for the employees who seemed to have little to no support from management.  Seemed very hostile and it was the least appealing environment ive been in, in awhile. I hope management can make some changes.

My friend won big at the casino today.... and so she took us to dinner....hooray! This place is expensive.... like almost Vegas expensive BUT it was better than the majority of the Vegas buffets... and I have done some serious buffeting. They had american kobe steaks that were tender and delicious. Creamy mashed potatoes. Tender broccolini. Wonton soup that is actually good (fairly rare for a buffet). Really good garlic bread. And to top it off.... A fancy cheese, meat, and fig display. The only thing that was not awesome was the lamb leg...but it still wasn't bad. The dessert set up was pretty awesome... fresh fruit, all different types of pies, tarts, cakes, ice cream, sorbet, and even fresh made bananas foster. I ate so much dessert. It was sick. They had some delicious chocolate mousse, tarts, and the bananas foster was excellent.... I am so glad we gave this place a try and I would definitely come back for another special occasion.   This buffet does a very good job of making you feel like you are in a nice restaurant and not necessarily a buffet. The buffet is separated from the dining room and there is very attentive service bringing drinks (all non alcoholic drinks included) and clearing plates. Gotta like that. Plus we had a view of the pool... not such a bad view.

The best buffett I have ever been too.  All you can eat lobster What more can you ask for.  Going to this buffet is more like an experience.  I live in NY, I wish we can have some of these great restaurants Here.  I just have to wait for my next trip to Arizona
Thanksgiving buffet here is amazing and that line is looonnnnnggggg. Wide variety of food and really on point with each style if food.

WHAT!?  5 stars.  Not a chance people.  I checked this place out because of the great reviews.  They use very nice china and cutleries.  It's clean.  The atmosphere was great but that was all this place has to offer.  The food was mediocre at best.  Asian station was panda express served on real china.  No sushi!!  Dumplings tasted like the frozen ones from Fresh and Easy.  The pizza was not any better than Peter Piper.  Dessert bar was comparable to Old Country Buffet.  Mexican food was mediocre.  Steak was a disappointment.  Gelato was okay.  G  Casino Buffets with no crab legs?  This place was a total disappointment.  NOT worth the money.

Breakfast buffet review: it's well worth the price and a good selection of breakfast items including some Asian dishes too.  I ordered a coffee, OJ & water - so don't be shy on your drink selections.  We came about an hour before the breakfast buffet closed but there still was a good selection of food and they were putting out fresh stuff!

We came for breakfast on a Friday 45 minutes after opening. The buffet is in a casino. You have your choice of valet parking, parking garage or self parking. You have to walk through the casino to get to the buffet, a clever marketing scheme for potential slots addicts. There were only a couple people here at this time so we were seated immediately at a table of our choice. The dining area was separate from the buffet so it had the feel of a formal dining room rather than a cafeteria. They had a wet bar on one end of the dining area near the buffet.    The buffet had a nice selection of pastries, fruit and cereal. The hot dished included several kinds of breakfast potatoes and meats. There were the fixins to make eggs ranchero and many other breakfast standards. They had about 10 different kinds of gelato to finish off the meal. The food was a good quality and tasty. I did however think the O'Brian potatoes were a little greasy. This is a place I will take visitors to for a local experience as it's not a casual dining venue. I want to try the dinner buffet as it sounds fantastic according to the menu, but the $26.00 price sounds a pricy.
Very thoughtful staff who prepared noodles specially for my table when I mentioned we were vegetarian.

I've been to this buffet on several occasions and left pleased. However this weekend we stayed at the hotel for my birthday, dinner on Saturday night was sub par compared to other occasions. We were severely disappointed to pay the same price for Sunday brunch to be served the EXACT same food as Saturday night dinner with the exception of a few egg dishes. Save your money and visit one of the other restaurants in the hotel.

Pretty solid buffet I must say.  I came here for the lunch buffet with some of my coworkers. If you come M-Thursday its $15 which is a pretty solid deal. The steak and shrimp fajitas were pretty good, I also liked the salmon and enchiladas. I do wish they had some tortillas though so you could wrap up the fajitas. Theres a few carving stations as well with different meats.  I finished off my meal at the dessert station. The cake slices I tried (cheesecake, tiramisu) seemed like they had been sitting out for a little and weren't that great. The gelato was awesome though. The mango and lemon flavors were my favorite.  Got a few plates in then hit the tables to win back what I just spent on lunch! What a win-win! Will be back again to try the dinner buffet.

Hands down the best buffet I've been to yet!   My cousins and I discussed many options before settling on this one. Although it can be pretty darn pricey, I honestly think it's worth it considering the extensive array of options you have for food, dessert, and drinks! So many amazing options; it's a little overwhelming! My favorite had to be their chicken salad and pasta dish.   They had so many different kinds of dessert, including various flavors of gelato. I came back so many times the staff remembered me (kind of embarrassing, but he was really funny and made light hearted jokes about it).  The staff here were unbelievable! I never expect much from the staff at a buffet, but our waitress and waiter were so great; they were refilling drinks every 10 minutes and clearing plates at the same time. They were all super sweet and nice and made great conversation with us.   Food here was so delicious, my family and I ate until we couldn't move.  The only downside was that there was some special show going on and we couldn't park on the premise. We had to park across the street and be go-carted to the entrance... which was pretty cool.

Food is average. Not a huge spread for as much as you pay. Also it's not a bottomless champagne brunch, it's a max 3 sparkling wine brunch.....for 36 bucks go to RR in old town Scottsdale or Lons at the hermosa, better food better "champagne"

Mother's day buffet today.   It was okay,  but probably not worth the cost at $54.95 per person. The crab legs were frozen,  but the prime rib and fresh cut bacon were delicious.   The dessert buffet was splendid with a lot of choices.   The wait to get in was over an hour long,  but it was very refreshing that they didn't rush us to leave.   Not sure if I will return ....

Went specifically for the king crab and lobster claws.  Never again!  King crab was cold and the lobster claws were so tough, overcooked and probably old.  Chef even verified and offered to cook up another plate for me.  By this time, after eating a couple of the others, I had no interest.  Actually been feeling a little ill since.  After the "mgr" acknowledged what the chef said, we were offered a glass of wine.

Service is good, they have a wide variety of desserts. It seems they lack meat though. The basic boneless chicken breast is nowhere to be found. For dinner , they should have more seafoods. I dint see mussels, crab legs, crabs. But they had shrimp and oysters. They had steak and lamb which was good too, salmon was overcooked it was really dry and chewy. I liked the steamed pollock ( not sure but it was white fish ) with veggies and rice. The ambiance is good, too.   Tip: when you do dinner, get there as early as 4:30pm,  yes, when they just barely open, especially if you are starving else you would have to wait before the other 25-30 people can get in.

I really want to love this place, and a huge part of me does, until my last experience. I was with my husband and mom, on a Friday night for dinner, and it was going really well. Our server was terrible, but other then that the food was amazing. It was when we were going for dessert, that as I walked past the bar area, I slipped on ice all over the floor, near the bar. I grabbed the wall in time, but my leg had already been hurt. The bartender was the biggest asshole I have ever met. He stared at me, holding my leg and my husband yelled at him to get some help. He rolled his eyes, and called and I asked him for some ice, and he said they are getting it, He then immediately tried to grab a towel to clean up the ice, and my mother and I both yelled at him to stop so we could take pictures. He was pissed. The medics came, and wrapped my leg, all while I was crying, and everyone was staring at me. I have never been so embarrassed. The bartender made it worse by giving me dirty looks the entire time. The chef though, he was amazing. He came out, asked if I was okay, and kept apologizing. He literally made it better, just by being kind. Then the manager came out. One I didnt know she was the manager because she didn't approach me and hid behind the medics. I asked the medic for the manager and she came forward, I told her that this is ridiculous, and that I didnt even get to finish my meal. I had to ask her for a refund! She ran to go get it and took 20 MINS!!!!!!!! I was crying because the pain was shooting up and down my leg. She finally came back and I was taken out in a wheel chair. Ive tried multiple times to get a hold of the GM but I got another manager instead who was rude and simply said soooo you got a refund....... I dont want freebies I wanted to talk about how the situation was handled. oh and fyi the Bartender makes all the drinks, soooooo guess whose fault it was for dropping ice everywhere, and me hurting my knee. I ended up missing my camping trip. So yea great food, shit service but they literally dont care if you hurt yourself because of their inept employees.

I was expecting Vegas quality but this is just a small casino in Arizona.  Get real, Joyce W.!  :(  We arrived at 6ish for a Saturday Dinner Buffet.  I believe it was $14/pp but I'm not entirely sure since someone else picked up the bill.  They had NY Strip, oysters both raw and fried, king crab legs, lobster claws, clams, mussels, tilapia ceviche, a fajita station, pizza, a cheese selection, fruits, salads, Asian stir fry, a very impressive dessert bar, et cetera.   Sure, the king crab legs were plenty and always stocked full but it was all frozen firm meat.  At one point, one of us asked someone to heat some up for us because it had ice chunks inside.  The raw oysters were sadly not fresh.  I was telling everyone I was going to down at least a dozen by myself.  Two fishy oysters in, I gave up.  You just can't choke down oysters that can't be pried off their shells.  I also ate one with too much horseradish to try to off-set the weird-taste but all I got was a clear sinus from it.  Whoa!  I heard the NY strip with au ju was pretty decent.  I regret not getting a cut because I was starting to feel like an ice cube from all the cold foods I was eating.  I think the highlight was dessert.  Everything was small and dainty and the serving size was perfect since I wanted to try a little bit of everything.  Give me more creme brulee and I'll be a happy camper.  I even had some sugar-free spumoni.  All-in-all, it was a decent dinner buffet for $14 with an okay selection.  It's a very clean dining area and the wait staff is friendly and on-point with clearing dishes away.  They keep the glasses filled and the tables stocked with wet napkins.
Huge fan of this place.  Great food, reasonable price.  The parking garage can get kind of full.  The food is top quality and the ambiance is nice.

Best breakfast buffet I have had and at a very good price. Everything was good: sliced pork belly, very flavorful bacon strips, wood-fired breakfast pizza (although they should use their good sausage gravy for the sauce), eggs with chorizo, and very good coffee. If I lived in this area I would come here just for this buffet.

I normally hate buffets and never would have dined here if not for my Dad choosing it for his birthday dinner. My dislike for buffets is due to its food wastage, however, this place is different because they donate uneaten food! I have it a low rating because the food itself is sub par, yet I would have given this place 5 stars for service alone! Amazing staff, that are kind and attentive, and that is everyone from the server to the dessert attendant to pizza chef. If this place was more affordable for the food quality received I would likely bring my family back simply on service alone. With that said, a normal everyday dinner price of $25 a head with no prime rib, crab legs, shrimp, etc. Is excessive. Furthermore, all children over ten years are considered adults. And paying $25, after tax, for each child is simply crazy, especially since my smallish nephew's barely ate a thing. I believe the excessive food wastage at wandering horse is due to people putting visual appealing foods on their plates only to be disappointed and not finishings then going to get something else. At least, that was our experience. I was very upset that I called ahead for a menu and when I got there it was different than described, and it was disappointing. The plus side is they have a pretty brick oven pizza section, however, any dreams of quality crust and amazing toppings is dashed when you take a bite and it is reminiscent of Little Ceasers and not Pizzeria Bianco, but again they will custom make whatever you ask and make it pretty, but they can only work with the poor ingredients they are given. All in all, for service it is excellent, but the food is bad and the selections and variety is worse. The dessert bar was bigger than the normal food selections. Need I say more?

This place went down hill food was cold heavyly salted like they don't taste it for quality very little to choose from cooks behind counter was more worried about talking among each other then helping with the food with their guests horrible cooking staff better buffets in arizona !

came here with the family on a Saturday for Alaskan king crab legs and it was delicious! their seafood is very fresh and tasty. all the other food items in the buffet are delicious with a wide variety of choices. their dessert selection was great too! the servers were very attentive and nice. I will definitely be back!
Excellent selection, something for everyone. Smoked salmon is great. Pork carving very good, stay away from the prime rib, it was tough. The desert island is heaven.

This has to be one of the best buffets in the Phoenix area. It is clean and all of the dishes are of high quality. On the weekends, they have seafood night, with crab legs, shrimp, and oysters on the half shell. The Sunday brunch is also superb: mimosas, seafood and carving station with meats such as brisket or roast. Granted, eating here is not cheap but for what you pay for, it is great value.

Came here for their AYCE Cold Water lobster on a Thursday night for $25.95.  We arrived at 6 pm and the place was already packed with a line.  The wait wasn't too long....you pay and then stand over to the side until they call your name with a place to sit.  Kinda nice so you don't have to battle it out to find a table.  The food is plentiful, but nothing that I would really say stood out. I came mainly for the lobster - and there was a long line for that - and they serve you 2 at a time.  It's pretty small since the meat is mainly from the tail.  You can finish 1 lobster in 2 bites.    The other foods there:  a Mexican Station with green enchiladas, corn, beans, rice and tortilla chips with salsa.  An Asian food Station with stir fried noodles, shrimp shumai, chicken wings and fried rice.  Salad bar, Pizza/pasta bar.  And meat bar with roast beef, steak and ham.  You also have your usual mashed potatoes and french fries.  Also a nice soup bar.  They also have oysters on the half shell that I did not try.  Their dessert bar (located in the middle) is tasty and full of varieties.  We had them make us a bananas foster over vanilla ice cream which was AMAZING.    All in all, I probably wouldn't come back again for the lobster feast - but I do know that their Sunday brunch is out of this world.  I'd come back for that.

We visited this buffet for Sunday brunch at my mother's request.  I am not a fan of buffets in general... mainly due to hygienic concerns.    However, this buffet was stellar.  They had saw-cut crab legs, which won me over right away.  Then there were all your usual buffet offerings.  They even had made-to-order corn tortillas with the Mexican food.  I hardly noticed the omelet station, which I usually run toward.  I did not see one person order an omelet during my entire meal.    To top off a very wide selection of really decent food, you were allowed your choice of three breakfast drinks: bloody marys, mimosas or champagne.  At first, we were a little annoyed because we thought it was unlimited champagne.  However, three glasses of champagne is REALLY enough.  Trust me.  Of course, I got DH to get me one of his drinks so, I had four.    At $27.95, this was a little pricey for a weekly brunch.  However, I think it will definitely be on the rotation in the future.  I crave that sweet crab every now and again and not having to crack it is an extra bonus!

Friday and Saturday is the Seafood Buffet Night with King Crab Legs and Burger Patty size Kobe Beef Steaks.   All the items are done very well and if you leave here hungry something is wrong with you.  When getting the King Crab Legs make sure you ask one of the cooks to boil them to eat hot.  If you are looking for a place for breakfast give it a try here from 8:00 am to 10;30 am for $10 per person.   There are custom omelettes, eggs, sausage, bacon, pancakes, french toast and the custom sliced pork belly.  Of course the desserts are very good and there is a case of gelato.  Will be back for more

I can only address the Christmas buffet offerings, my only visit to this buffet thus far. Food was excellent in every category I tried. Impossible to try them all in one meal there is so much variety. Highlights for me included the lamb chops with mint sauce and the Alaskan crab legs. The sideboard items such as veal roast and prime rib looked just as good and well prepared. Coconut macadamia shrimp was so well flavored I wished I had saved room for more. The large variety of  handmade deserts were just as delicious as they looked. There may be a wait line for the buffet. Very worth the wait and cost considering that many of the items sold individually in a served restaurant in Scottsdale are nearing cost of this buffet. The Christmas buffet is priced higher than other times, but includes three glasses of champagne or mimosas. This was far better than any Vegas buffet at fine hotels I have tried.

We went on a Saturday evening. They had the king crab legs and other shells at the seafood bar. They were the highlight of the dinner. They also had lamb at the carving station and roasted goat meat at the Mexican station. A variety of gelato and sorbet flavours were a major bonus. It was definitely worth the price you pay for the variety of food you get!

Showed up to treat my wife to a nice night out and was greeted with a price tag twice the normal price. Ok Valentine night something different might be worth it. Except it was not really different than normal just twice the price. Use to come often I won't go back so hope that price hike is worth the lose of a regular customer.
